items.currency.fallenEmber.description:
A mysterious, smoldering fragment that can be used to <color=#F2E6BD>alter enchanted items</color>. 

Rumors say these rare stones were also used in ancient Cerim rituals of rebirth.

items.gear.armor.tier0.cerimTattersA.her.description: The tattered remnants of a Cerim cloak.

items.gear.armor.tier0.cerimTattersA.her.name: Tattered Cerim Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier0.cerimTattersA.her.description: The frayed scraps of what was once a powerful Cerim garment.

The frayed scraps of what was once a powerful Cerim garment.

items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.name: Cerim Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.description: A traditional cloak made by the Cerim, imbued with the words of the Sayer.

items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.name: Cerim Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.description: A pair of gloves crafted by the Cerim, imbued with the words of the Sayer.

items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.name: Cerim Hood
items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.description: A protective hood stitched by the Cerim, imbued with the words of the Sayer.

items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.name: Cerim Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier0.prologueCerimArmo.description: A pair of leg guards favored by the Cerim, imbued with the words of the Sayer.

items.gear.armor.tier1.beggar.tatteredJu.name: Tattered Jute Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier1.beggar.tatteredJu.description: The pants of one accustomed to sleeping on hard stone.

items.gear.armor.tier1.beggar.tatteredJu.name: Tattered Jute Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier1.beggar.tatteredJu.description: The pitiful rags of one who has given up hope.

items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.name: Cleric Vestments
items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.description: The stark white robes of a Cleric from the north.

items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.name: Cleric Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.description: These red leather gloves are a hallmark of the feared Clerics of Coventon.

items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.name: Cleric Bonnet
items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.description: This prestigious red bonnet is said to protect the Clerics of Coventon from impure thoughts.

items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.name: Cleric Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier1.cleric.heroCleric.description: These crimson leather trousers weren't woven by mystics; but when you feel them you'll think they were.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.name: Duelist Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.description: A tarnished robe, ideal for quick movement and treachery.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.name: Duelist Palms
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.description: Leather gloves lined with metal studs, for light protection.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.name: Duelist Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.description: Each blow against this curved helm reverberates through the body, and echoes out through the lash of a weapon.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.name: Duelist Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelist.heroDueli.description: Shabby leather pants, better for deception and guile than comfort.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.name: Gladesman's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.description: A worn pair of leather mitts that never seem to fit quite right.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.name: Gladesman's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.description: A good pair of trousers offers protection against enemies, the elements, and knee-high critters.

items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.name: Gladesman's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier1.duelistVariationB.description: An old duelist's robe, saturated with the vague stench of moss and blood.

items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.name: Cloak of Rags
items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.description: An unassuming cloak worn by wanderers who prefer not to be remembered.

items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.name: Ragged Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.description: Armored gloves sharp enough to break the silence, should silence fail you.

items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.name: Cowl of Rags
items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.description: A ragged mantle made of elk hide, worn by those who prefer the company of shadows.

items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.name: Ragged Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier1.fallenPhoenix.fal.description: A set of worn armor legs dyed the color of dusk — ideal for walking where one shouldn’t be seen.

items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.name: Farmer's Rags
items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.description: The simple tunic of one who tills the earth.

items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.name: Farmer's Thumb
items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.description: A pair of well-worn gloves, familiar with the dirt.

items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.name: Farmer's Cap
items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.description: A humble head covering, ideal for blocking the sun while gardening.

items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.name: Farmer's Cords
items.gear.armor.tier1.farmer.heroFarmer.description: A pair of shabby trousers with mud stains on the knees.

items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.name: Rootspeaker Vestments
items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.description: A tunic of twigs that rustles incessantly, even without wind.

items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.name: Rootspeaker Tendrils
items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.description: A pair of gloves woven from creeping roots that never stop growing.

items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.name: Rootspeaker Mantle
items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.description: Why gaze in admiration at the tree, when you can become the tree?

items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.name: Rootspeaker Stalks
items.gear.armor.tier1.herbalist.herbali.description: Let your feet be as roots; firm and grounded. And let your trousers also be as roots; foul-smelling and brittle.

items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.name: Mudstalker's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.description: A pair of simple, tidy leather gloves. Their cleanliness belies a long history of treachery.

items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.name: Mudstalker's Hood
items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.description: A crimson cowl, perhaps woven by a thief who abandoned the isle of Tanth but retained the island's cunning.

items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.name: Mudstalker's Jerkin
items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.description: The tunic of a wretch, a desperate soul, one who was grateful to be released into God's Embrace.

items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.name: Mudstalker's Pants
items.gear.armor.tier1.heroRogueVariatio.description: Worn leather leggings, stained by the marshes of Tanth. They bear the marks of one who crept through filth and shadow, unseen yet never unscathed.

items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingB.name: Twine King's Armor
items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingB.description: “The world is woven by the wise; only a fool would tug at its seams.” -the Twine King

items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingG.name: Twine King's Fingers
items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingG.description: “Cut the thread early, or watch it strangle you later.” -the Twine King

items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingH.name: Twine King's Crown
items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingH.description: “Every knot curses the hand that tied it.” -the Twine King

items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingP.name: Twine King's Stance
items.gear.armor.tier1.knight.twineKingP.description: “No tapestry is finished while the weaver still breathes.”-the Twine King

items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.name: Ranger Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.description: The leather coat of a woodland ranger, ideal for hunting.

items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.name: Ranger Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.description: A pair of hardy gloves belonging to a woodland hunter.

items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.name: Ranger Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.description: A lightweight morion helm, favored by forest stalkers and trackers.

items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.name: Ranger Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier1.ranger.heroRanger.description: Dark leather trousers that resemble the murk of an inland forest.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.name: Wildling Coat
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.description: A sturdy tunic, stitched by hand and stained with blood.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.name: Wildling Fingers
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.description: Tough but ragged, much like their former owner.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.name: Wildling Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.description: The mottled steel helmet of an outlaw. Sure to have seen its share of blows.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.name: Wildling Pants
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCaptain.hero.description: A pair of drab trousers stitched in Lion's Mound. Coarse and unwashed.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.name: Knave's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.description: A garment often worn by the lowliest Risen, held together with rage and hubris.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.name: Knave's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.description: The lowliest thieves are lucky to even have their hands covered.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.name: Knave's Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenCrawler.hero.description: A pair of ratty trousers, often worn by the Risen's most humble soldiers.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.name: Thieving Drifter Garb
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.description: A cloak imbued with treachery, bloodshed in its past.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.name: Thieving Drifter Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.description: Gloves that would sooner close around a man's neck than till a field.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.name: Thieving Drifter Hood
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.description: The faded hood of a Risen soldier, with poor visibility for attacks from behind.

items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.name: Thieving Drifter Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier1.risenScoundrel.he.description: These trousers did not believe in their former owner's cause.

items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueBo.name: Dark Leather Jerkin
items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueBo.description: A cloak said to be woven out of nothing but stealth and shadow. (Made by a liar.)

items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueGl.name: Dark Leather Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueGl.description: Coarse brown gloves that slide on without a sound.

items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueHe.name: Dark Leather Hood
items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRogueHe.description: The hood of one who is about to commit foul deeds.

items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRoguePa.name: Dark Leather Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier1.rogue.heroRoguePa.description: A pair of simple trousers, yes. But trousers with a sinister air about them.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.name: Mariner's Rig
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.description: The shirt of a lawless sea dog, caked with salt and adventure.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.name: Mariner's Salt Wick
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.description: A simple rag to keep the sea spray out of one's hair. (Ineffective.)

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.name: Mariner's Sea Legs
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorA.heroSailo.description: A pair of wide-legged trousers, to let the wind in and keep the smells out.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorAVariation..name: Mariner's Land Legs
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorAVariation..description: A pair of trousers dyed teal by design, and parched white by the ocean's spray.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorB.heroSailo.name: Helmsman's Jacket
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorB.heroSailo.description: The faded coat of a middle ranking seaman - likely stolen and traded by pirates.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorB.heroSailo.name: Helmsman's Pantaloons
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorB.heroSailo.description: Trousers made of soft linen. They have seen many harsh days at sea.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.name: Sailor's Slops
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.description: A simple cotton shirt, favored by traders from the mainland.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.name: Sailor's Bandana
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.description: Take any cloth, fold it three ways, and you have this.

items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.name: Striped Sailor's Braies
items.gear.armor.tier1.sailorC.heroSailo.description: More stylish than most rags, but rags nonetheless.

items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.name: Caylen Scholar Robes
items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.description: This holy cloak has been patched and repaired many times since the Mountain Gate fell shut.

items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.name: Caylen Scholar Manchettes
items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.description: Gloves made from ironweave, once worn by a scholar of the Holy City.

items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.name: Caylen Scholar Hood
items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.description: The hood of a learned scholar, likely employed in the archives of the Great Cathedral.

items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.name: Caylen Scholar Britches
items.gear.armor.tier1.scholar.heroSchol.description: Durable and well-made, no doubt stitched by artisans of the Holy City.

items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.name: Hearthguard Coat
items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.description: An armor of quilted cloth and tempered steel; warm as a sunrise, cold as its shadow.

items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.name: Hearthguard Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.description: A pair of hammered gauntlets that will keep their warmth long after the wearer’s hands have gone cold.

items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.name: Hearthguard Cowl
items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.description: A hood the color of dying coals, just before the night swallows the day.

items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.name: Hearthguard Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier1.skybornPaladin.sk.description: Forged on the mainland, in a smithy just outside of Elgarth which burned to the ground in the year 826.

items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.name: Dredge Knight Armor
items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.description: Heavy chainmail wrapped around a cloak as iridescent as the sea… The origins of this armor are mysterious.

items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.name: Dredge Knight Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.description: Gloves belonging to an unknown warrior, possibly from the Strait of Oroth.

items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.name: Dredge Knight Hood
items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.description: A drape of cloth that shimmers with ill intent. Little is known about its origins.

items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.name: Dredge Knight Bottoms
items.gear.armor.tier1.soddenKnight.dred.description: Dark leather pants, draped in chain mail for extra protection.

items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.name: Squire's Attire
items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.description: The humble armor of a knight in training. Simple but effective protection.

items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.name: Squire's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.description: An ornately encrusted helmet, forged by Sacrament's longtime smithy Fillmore.

items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.name: Squire's Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.description: Simple leather trousers, of the type given to novice warriors.

items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.name: Squire's Hands
items.gear.armor.tier1.squire.heroSquire.description: Light and nimble, these gloves protect the hand from slashing attacks.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.name: Reckless Tallbear Garb
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.description: What the Risen lack in discipline, they make up for with bravado.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.name: Reckless Tallbear Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.description: A pair of loud, clanging gloves, built as much for show as for protection.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.name: Reckless Tallbear Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.description: A heavy helm capable of thwarting both mutinies and betrayals - tactics long favored by the Risen.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.name: Reckless Tallbear Pants
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeader.hero.description: May these pants bear their new wearer to better fortune than their former owners.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.name: Fellhorn's Fist
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.description: "When shaking hands with the Risen, always watch the one that isn't." - overheard in Havenport

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.name: Fellhorn's Hollow
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.description: A formidable barricade of steel and cloth, as heavy as it is impractical.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.name: Fellhorn's Stride
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.description: On its way to being armor, but not quite armor.

items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.name: Fellhorn's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier2.banditLeaderVaria.description: The battered but ornate armor of a Risen Fellhorn. All fall, only some rise!

items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.name: Smithy's Smock
items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.description: A thick leather apron suited for hot, hard work around the forge.

items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.name: Smithy's Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.description: Thick working gloves, able to withstand high temperatures.

items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.name: Smithy's Bottoms
items.gear.armor.tier2.blacksmith.heroBl.description: They say the trousers are the least important part of a smithy's uniform… But try forging in a skirt.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.name: Bastard's Cuirass
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.description: It's said the Boarskin believe themselves descendents of Kafron Bilsgard. Attempts at further questioning on the subject have gone poorly.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.name: Bastard's Grip
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.description: "Every foe a feast." - Boarskin battle cry, meaning uncertain

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.name: Bastard's Boar Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.description: Those who fear the dogs of war have never seen the pigs.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.name: Bastard's Legs
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinBastard.b.description: Many travelers have hidden in the tall grass, watching in fear as these leggings stalk past.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.name: Mangler's Harness
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.description: One hopes it's woven from the clothes of Boarskin victims, as opposed to from their hides.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.name: Mangler's Grasp
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.description: Caked with dried blood, worn and stained and coarse. Make no mistake: these are butcher's gloves.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.name: Mangler's Tusk Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.description: Perhaps the Boarskin wear such headdresses out of fondness for their porcine brothers. Perhaps they just ran out of human skulls.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.name: Mangler's Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinMangler.b.description: These leggings resemble the Boarskin family tree - very few branches and some alarming gaps

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..name: Preacher's Rags
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..description: The Boarskin Preacher's tunic is sewn from the hides of those who didn't survive their "sermon."

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..name: Preacher's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..description: A litany of brutalities stitched down the length of each finger.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..name: Preacher's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..description: The Boarskin don't remove the arrows of those who almost brought them down. Perhaps a sign of respect, perhaps a taunt.

items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..name: Preacher's Walk
items.gear.armor.tier2.boarskinPreacher..description: If you were an inbred tribe of half-feral marauders, your pants would likely smell this way too.

items.gear.armor.tier2.carpenter.heroCar.name: Carpenter's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier2.carpenter.heroCar.description: A linen shirt traditionally worn by members of Sacrament's Guild of Carpenters.

items.gear.armor.tier2.carpenter.heroCar.name: Carpenter Pants
items.gear.armor.tier2.carpenter.heroCar.description: Linen pants traditionally worn by members of Sacrament's Guild of Carpenters.

items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakBo.name: Falstead's Wrath
items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakBo.description: The body armor of the Risen Falstead. They say he forged the steel with his own teeth.

items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakGl.name: Falstead's Reach
items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakGl.description: Heavy gauntlets worn by the Risen Falstead, though his palms were as coarse as any metal.

items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakHe.name: Falstead's Burden
items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakHe.description: The helm of the great Falstead Darak, the warlord who would either unite the Risen - or destroy them.

items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakPa.name: Falstead's Relief
items.gear.armor.tier2.darak.heroDarakPa.description: The rough, durable leggings of the Falstead. Said to be woven with strands of his own leg hair.

items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidBo.name: Druid's Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidBo.description: A robe made of dappled light, likely woven by the timber druids of Myrfall.

items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidGl.name: Druid's Touch
items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidGl.description: Gloves made of wood and earth, molded by an ancient forest cult.

items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidHe.name: Druid's Eye
items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidHe.description: Who wears this helmet shall see beyond the now, into the age of trees.

items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidPa.name: Druid's Roots
items.gear.armor.tier2.druid.heroDruidPa.description: Leggings of unknown origin. Probably from the wooded isles beyond the Shattered Hand.

items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.name: Kindler's Mantle
items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.description: Leaving so much of the skin exposed while wielding fire might seem odd. But then not all Risen are great forward planners.

items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.name: Kindler's Broadcap
items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.description: The incandescent helm of a Risen Kindler, one of the outfit's most volatile warriors.

items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.name: Kindler's Braes
items.gear.armor.tier2.firebombBandit.he.description: Heavy, course trousers soaked in soot and flame oil.

items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.name: Scuttler's Scales
items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.description: Mottled and soggy, this tunic once belonged to a Scuttler from the ragged coasts east of Sacrament.

items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.name: Scuttler's Claws
items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.description: Sure to leave your wrinkled fingers with a stench of seaweed.

items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.name: Scuttler's Breath
items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.description: A hood made of coarse, waterlogged threads plundered from Sacra's shores.

items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.name: Scuttler's Treaders
items.gear.armor.tier2.fisherman.heroFis.description: Wear them for too long and one may find barnacles in unexpected places.

items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersAp.name: Pantler's Apron
items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersAp.description: Never a war was won on an empty stomach!

items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersCa.name: Pantler's Cap
items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersCa.description: Most noblemen presume such caps are strictly decorative; but a good chef knows they're ideal for pastry storage.

items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersTr.name: Pantler's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier2.gordon.pantlersTr.description: Every taste that went into the soup, and many that didn't, can be found smeared on these trousers.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bane's Coarse Legs
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: Tough leather trousers, stitched together with thick strands of Alpine Goat hair.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bane's Crested Armor
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: Regal, tufted, and impenetrable. The body armor of a Risen Breaker who claimed the highest body count of anyone short of Darak himself.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bane's Skull Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: In the end, revolution often gives way to terror.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bane's Spiked Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: It's said that only two kinds of people ever shake hands with the Risen - living traitors and dead fools.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bastion's Bulwark
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: The former war plate of one of the Risen's most reviled champions. Said to weigh as much as normal suit of armor, with a man inside.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bastion's Glare
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: The demented helmet of a Risen warlord who has forgotten everything in life but the scent of battle.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bastion's Stance
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: Heavy trousers, soaked with so much sweat and blood that they bend and creak like tree limbs

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Bastion's Vise
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: Coarse gloves for gripping heavy weapons, or the crumpled skulls of enemies.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Risen Breaker Warplate
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: The Risen have been known to cobble together formidable suits of armor from their broken enemies.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Risen Breaker Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: They fit no pair of hands as neatly as they fit around an enemy's throat.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Risen Breaker Crest
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: A helmet crested with dark feathers, for a Breaker's axe swoops down upon their prey as swiftly as any eagle.

items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.name: Risen Breaker Legs
items.gear.armor.tier2.heavyBruiserBandi.description: Stained with the mud of the fields, the blood of their enemies, and the occasional shit-smear of a mistimed respite.

items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptyFi.name: The Empty Fist
items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptyFi.description: Let your enemy feel only the wind before your hand, and then nothing.

items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptyMi.name: The Empty Mind
items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptyMi.description: Let your enemy believe that your plans are his thoughts.

items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptySt.name: The Empty Step
items.gear.armor.tier2.ilaria.theEmptySt.description: Let your enemy see only where you have been.

items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.name: Rebel's Voice
items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.description: A simple tunic, hand-stitched in Marin Village.

items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.name: Rebel's Grip
items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.description: A pair of simple leather gloves, no different from any others.

items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.name: Rebel's Run
items.gear.armor.tier2.odessa.heroOdessa.description: "If your purpose is true, you will always find the wind at your back." - Dasha proverb

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Harvester Armor
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.description: The strongest threads, the sharpest steel. Nothing is too fine for the Knights of Tanth.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Harvester Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.description: A stern, powerful set of gauntlets forged on the island of Tanth.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Harvester Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.description: The crimson helm of a Tanth Harvester, the most feared of the island's many assassins.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Harvester Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandA.heroOrlan.description: It's said that the Knights of Tanth wear crimson so they always have somewhere to wipe their blades.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Scout Armor
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.description: An impeccable garment from Tanth, possibly woven from the rich fur of a Kylesh seal.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Scout Fingers
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.description: Sleek leather gloves worn by a Tanth marauder, for those who like to murder in style.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Scout Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.description: Lightweight helmet that once belonged to a loathsome tracker from the island of Tanth.

items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Scout Legs
items.gear.armor.tier2.orlandC.heroOrlan.description: A set of crimson leg armor with jagged steel knee guards. Beware the jab from Tanth that strikes below the waist.

items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.name: Snout Master's Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.description: Pride of the Boarskin. Enemy of the nostrils.

items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.name: Snout Master's Feet
items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.description: Thick trousers made of hide, or flesh; it makes no difference to the Boarskin.

items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.name: Snout Master's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.description: A pair of warrior's gloves, coarse and tough on the outside, filled with soft grease on the inside.

items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.name: Snout Master's Hood
items.gear.armor.tier2.pigHeadBandit.pig.description: The eldest leaders of the Boarskin are said to see, and speak, entirely through the beasts on their bellies.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.name: Ironhand Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.description: The Ironhand eschew protection for mobility - the best defense is a quick axe buried in an enemy's skull.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.name: Ironhand Grips
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.description: "Where my axe goes, my arm follows. Where my hand points, my axe goes." - Ironhand mantra

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.name: Ironhand Hood
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.description: Nick a foe's artery and you'll understand why the Risen like to keep their hoods up.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.name: Ironhand Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenIronhand.ris.description: The more the mainland strips away Sacra's dignity, the more its residents clothe themselves in the Risen's colors.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.name: Stormwall Breastplate
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.description: "Isn't a group of rebels supposed to be dressed in rags and tatters?" - Randolph, Captain of the Sacrament Guard

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.name: Stormwall Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.description: The Stormwall take their name from Phalen's great sea barrier. It holds back the ocean, the Stormwall hold back Phalen.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.name: Stormwall Casque
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.description: A helmet doesn't just protect a head, it hides a soul. Drenched in darkness, any deed is made possible.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.name: Stormwall Chausses
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenStormwall.ri.description: Leggings meant to turn a man into a wall.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.name: Vagabond Coat
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.description: A richly woven and finely dyed leather tunic. Indicative of high standing and low morals.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.name: Vagabond Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.description: A pair of leather gloves that have been scrubbed coarse in a futile effort to remove bloodstains.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.name: Vagabond Skullcap
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.description: The dashing cap of a bandit who looked good and had an empty soul.

items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.name: Vagabond Leg Guards
items.gear.armor.tier2.risenVagabond.her.description: When the bloodshed and battle lulls, one must find other ways to entertain.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.name: Spearman's Brace
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.description: Sturdy, robust armor hammered in the forges of Eversol's greatest smiths.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.name: Spearman's Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.description: A pair of thick iron gloves, good for preventing injury and callouses.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.name: Spearman's Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.description: What it lacks in sight it makes up in raw strength. Forged from heavy iron.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.name: Spearman's Leg Guards
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearman.heroSpea.description: Your enemy may hear your steps a mile away, but they will be powerless to stop your coming.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.name: Gilded Spearman's Brace
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.description: Always tend to your armor, that the glint of the sun may blind your enemies. - Boroth, Arena Master

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.name: Gilded Spearman's Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.description: A pair of hammered battle gloves, luxurious and impenetrable.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.name: Gilded Spearman's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.description: Intimidating in battle, cumbersome for travel.

items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.name: Gilded Spearman's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.spearmanVariation.description: A powerful golden helmet that still reeks faintly of its former owner's breath.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.name: Ceremonial Nith Leg Guards
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.description: A scrap of aged leather, still dripping wet from the bogs of the Orban Glades.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.name: Ceremonial Nith Mask
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.description: Crafted by the shamans of the swamp. Designed to intimidate more than protect.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.name: Ceremonial Nith Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.ceremo.description: A fetid collection of rags used by the Nith for their notorious "quagmire" rituals.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.name: Screamer's Tatters
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.description: Does some corner of their minds remember civil society, a reflex to wrap their bodies in these putrid rags?

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.name: Screamer's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.description: For some, illness and rot is a slow creep. For the Screamer, it's a blistering frenzy, a madness of decay.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.name: Screamer's Bone Helm
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.description: Late at night the Orban Glades echo with the Nith's guttural screams, reverberating within their masks of bone.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.name: Screamer's Stalks
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.heroSw.description: The acidic swamps rot away the Nith's legs, leaving only bone, splints of wood, and these shredded leggings.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.name: Molding Nith Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.description: The more colorful the fungus, the more it strengthens the leather.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.name: Molding Nith Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.description: Blurring the line between fabric and flesh.

items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.name: Molding Nith Skullcap
items.gear.armor.tier2.swampEnemy.tradit.description: It is said that the Nith do not keep trophies from their enemies. Instead, they become them.

items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.name: Tanth Captain Armor
items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.description: The thick body armor of a ruthless mercenary from beyond Sacra's shores.

items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.name: Tanth Captain Cask
items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.description: The helm of an elite marauder from Tanth, a madman from a mad land.

items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.name: Tanth Captain Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.description: A pair of vivid gloves dyed with crushed madder root, probably plundered from the coasts of Waithe.

items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.name: Tanth Captain Stalkers
items.gear.armor.tier2.tanth.tanthCaptai.description: Crimson for walking, crimson for stalking, crimson for killing.

items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.redsGrasp.name: Scarlet Grasp
items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.redsGrasp.description: To join The Red, a woman must cut ties with all lovers and paramours. And the word cut is often taken quite literally.

items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.scaletWarp.name: Scarlet Warplate
items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.scaletWarp.description: The chestpiece of The Red, a female gang of brutal, unscrupulous marauders. They take what they want and leave the rest for the crows.

items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.vermillion.name: Scarlet Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier2.theRed.vermillion.description: The Red fear no god nor government, and so they rob the living, mock the dead, and live only for the moment.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.name: Wretched Archer Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.description: A lightweight outfit crafted in the forests of Myrfall. The further the shot, the safer the kill.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.name: Wretched Archer Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.description: Sparse leather hand coverings designed to favor dexterity and stealth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.name: Wretched Archer Cap
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.description: The plumed helm of an archer, likely from Rog or Kafir.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.name: Wretched Archer Pants
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroArcher.description: Smartly wrapped leather pants that favor movement and minimize noise.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.name: Crestfallen Archer Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.description: Swift, cunning, and black-hearted was the former owner of this garment.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.name: Crestfallen Archer Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.description: For those who have yet to develop sufficient callouses on their draw fingers.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.name: Crestfallen Archer Cap
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.description: It matters less what lies inside an archer's skull than what lies inside her quiver.

items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.name: Crestfallen Archer Pants
items.gear.armor.tier3.archer.heroCrestf.description: Made of deer hide, stitched tightly to be waterproof and silent.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.clawsO.name: Claws of the Beak
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.clawsO.description: A hand may grasp, but a talon enfolds.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.crestO.name: Crest of the Beak
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.crestO.description: When worn as a gift, it bestows great honor. When worn in plunder, it promises doom.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.plumeO.name: Plume of the Beak
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.plumeO.description: Is it said that the cloak of the Great Beak contains one feather from every creature that flies in all the realms of Atlan.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.tailOf.name: Tail of the Beak
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdLeader.tailOf.description: "Beware the tree that moves when the wind is still." -only known words spoken by the Great Beak to have been translated in the common tongue

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.name: Mad Brambler Claws
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.description: It is said that the feathered gloves of the Balak Taw let them loose arrows as silently as a bird flies.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.name: Mad Brambler Drapings
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.description: A coarse set of feathers earned when a young Balak Taw kills his first Alpine Goat.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.name: Mad Brambler's Legs
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.description: Travelers often remark that a Balak Taw warrior is as quiet and stealthy as a bird - and yet somehow as gratingly loud as one too.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.name: Mad Brambler's Tuft
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorA.madB.description: Where once was the head of a man, now shall be only plumage.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.name: Stalking Jay's Coat
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.description: The feathers of this cloak are said to come from the Kestrels of Waithe - exceedingly rare on Sacra.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.name: Stalking Jay's Crest
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.description: The crown is rumored to be dyed red from the Great Beak herself placing a bloody hand upon the Jay's head during its rite of initiation.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.name: Stalking Jay's Stride
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorB.stal.description: Coarse leggings belonging to one of the Balak Taw's most dangerous assassins.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.name: Wild Finch Crown
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.description: The elegant crest of one of the Balak Taw's elite breed of warriors.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.name: Wild Finch Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.description: Leg guards woven out of coarse leather... which is said to come from the flayed flesh of fallen Boarskin.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.name: Wild Finch Plumage
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.description: It is not only the people of Sacra who fear the Balak Taw. For the wild birds of Marin now live under constant threat of being "harvested."

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.name: Wild Finch Talons
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorC.wild.description: The Balak Taw have not always been on Sacra. But few people alive can recall a time when the Marin Woods were safe.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.name: Heavy Feather Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.description: This majestic coat is given to only a handful of Balak Taw warriors. It must first be blessed by the Great Beak himself.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.name: Heavy Feather Leg Guards
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.description: A pair of trousers molded to be as thick and coarse as the bark of an oak.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.name: Heavy Feather Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.description: Leather gauntlets thick enough to pound your enemy into the mud, until their flesh rejoins the earth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.name: Heavy Feather's Nest
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorD.heav.description: So swift to strike and so firm of stance is the Heavy Feather that it is said the eggs shall never break.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.name: Hive Slinger Legs
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.description: No one knows exactly how the Balak Taw are able to stitch their garments to be so lush and dense with feathers, yet soundless as a bird of prey.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.name: Hive Slinger Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.description: A pair of feathered gloves, so swift and light they'll leave your enemies wondering if you ever touched them.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.name: Hive Slinger Plume
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.description: A crest imbued with the pride of the Balak Taw. Wear it, and feel their eyes upon you.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.name: Hive Slinger Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorE.hive.description: A heavy leather coat draped in iridescent feathers. Let others wear the camouflage, while you draw the enemy's eye.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.name: Bone Hawk Crest
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.description: Primarily a ceremonial dressing, this feathered crown can also be a powerful distraction in combat.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.name: Bone Hawk Feathers
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.description: A tunic born in the trees, woven from the wind, and blessed by the air herself. Or so the Balak Taw claim.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.name: Bone Hawk Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.description: Crafted from hides, feathers, and resin, these gloves have a …distinct... odor to them.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.name: Bone Hawk Pants
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorF.bone.description: "There's only so much land, but there's always more air." --rumored Balak Taw proverb

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.cham.name: Champion of the Egg
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.cham.description: The prized plumage of the Unbreakable Egg, elusive champion of the treetops.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.clut.name: Clutch of the Egg
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.clut.description: A pair of powerful mitts coated with feathers plucked from the toughest raptor on Sacra.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.crow.name: Crown of the Egg
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.crow.description: Who carries this crown shall find honor and reward in the presence of the Great Beak.

items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.legs.name: Legs of the Egg
items.gear.armor.tier3.birdWarriorG.legs.description: Let your legs be as strong as a tree, and let your feet be as unmoving as its roots.

items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.name: Captain's Sigil
items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.description: A suit of armor should be like a soldier's backbone - rigid, stern, and unassailable.

items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.name: Captain's Fists
items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.description: A soldier's gauntlets are an extension of his hands. They are built for grasping and guiding the world to order.

items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.name: Captain's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.description: The strength of a soldier's helm is the difference between carrying out God's work and meeting God in person.

items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.name: Captain's Stride
items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.description: A soldier should always keep his boots firmly planted on the ground that he protects.

items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.name: Lieutenant's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier3.captainRandolph.h.description: Those who wear the armor of Sacrament must pledge themselves to shore up her walls like iron, and fall upon her enemies like rain.

items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.name: Wayfinder's Shawl
items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.description: A fair cloak stitched with many hidden pockets; for inks, compasses, and collected secrets.

items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.name: Wayfinder's Touch
items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.description: Half-fingered gloves stained with dust from every corner of Sacra.

items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.name: Wayfinder's Cap
items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.description: An angular shroud stitched of heavy, pale cloth - to block out the sun during long survey missions.

items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.name: Wayfinder's Path
items.gear.armor.tier3.cartographer.cart.description: "A map shows the way; a foot decides the truth." --Eron Plinthy, Cartographer of House Orland

items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.name: Holy Prisoner Rags
items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.description: A filthy, ragged cape belonging to one who formerly lived and worked in the Nameless Pass.

items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.name: Holy Prisoner Pillory
items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.description: The quarry in the Nameless Pass was manned by prisoners from Fort Reach. Until the Pestilence arrived.

items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.name: Holy Prisoner Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier3.caylenPrisonerGar.description: A pathetic pair of trousers belonging to a former prisoner.

items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.name: Covenant Knight Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.description: Worn by one who served both steel and Speaker. The oaths may be broken, but the armor endures.

items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.name: Covenant Knight Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.description: Each finger etched with a vow. Break one, and the metal will remember.

items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.name: Covenant Knight Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.description: A pair of heavy leg guards polished to a ceremonial shine, dented by many forgotten wars.

items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.name: Covenant Knight Sallet
items.gear.armor.tier3.darkKnight.covena.description: Narrow of vision, heavy with tradition. The helm of one who followed, not questioned.

items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardA.name: Groveguard Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardA.description: "Why put a target on my back, when I can wear one on my front?"  - Groveguard of Havenport

items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardG.name: Groveguard Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardG.description: Leather gloves thick enough to prick with a thorn, or stick with a dagger.

items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardH.name: Groveguard Helm
items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardH.description: Every weapon forged needs to be tested at some point.

items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardT.name: Groveguard Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier3.dummy.groveguardT.description: Pray that your enemies aim for the shins.

items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.name: Shriek of the Talon
items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.description: A storm speaks once. Everything else is just echo.

items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.name: Stare of the Talon
items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.description: When the air tastes like metal, look for lightning. When the air tastes like blood, look for Talon & Wrath.

items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.name: Leap of the Talon
items.gear.armor.tier3.duoKnight.heroDuo.description: “Fealty ends only when the body does.” -Wrath

items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.name: Noble Leather Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.description: A cloak which has seen far more of the world than its refined threadwork might suggest.

items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.name: Noble Iron Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.description: A pair of heavy gloves suited for shaking hands as much as clutching weapons.

items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.name: Noble Leather Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier3.ellsworth.heroEll.description: Leather breeches that were hand-made in Marin Village, though not many people know this.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.name: False Guardian's Robe
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.description: Those foolish or greedy enough to steal ancient Cerim armor find themselves trapped within their own tomb.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.name: False Guardian's Palms
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.description: Gauntlets such as these litter Sacra - relics of an ancient war - daring only the most desperate to slip them on.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.name: False Guardian's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.description: It's unknown if the poor souls trapped beneath the ancient helm are still alive, dead, or some horror in between.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.name: False Guardian's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseGuardian.fal.description: Some say that, late at night in Sacrament's cemetery, you can hear the sound of thudding steps far below.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.name: False Harbinger's Raiment
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.description: The armor may be ancient Cerim, but the body found within it is somehow both far younger and long dead.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.name: False Harbinger's Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.description: They shiver with the energy of the ancient, the Sayer's words long since twisted into lies.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.name: False Harbinger's Visage
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.description: Empty eyes stare out from its sockets, a silent scream captured forever in its teeth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.name: False Harbinger's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseHarbinger.fa.description: The heavy footfalls of graverobbers turned into guardians, scavengers hollowed out into shambling shells.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseNoble.falseN.name: False Noble Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseNoble.falseN.description: From the proudest king to the lowest grave robber, everyone lies to themselves.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseNoble.falseN.name: False Noble Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseNoble.falseN.description: A pair of powerful, hammered-steel gloves that can reach toward the might of the Cerim, but never grasp it.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseOathkeeper.f.name: False Oathkeeper's Visage
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseOathkeeper.f.description: One can only imagine what ancient battlefields and plagued monstrosities these eyes have gazed upon.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseRemnant.fals.name: False Remnant's Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseRemnant.fals.description: The False Ones do not eat nor drink, sleep nor rest. Their penance is ceaseless and eternal.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseShrinebreake.name: False Shrinebreaker Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseShrinebreake.description: This cloak may have been stitched by ancient hands and imbued with the power of the Sayer - but its most recent owner was a sad, desperate thief.

items.gear.armor.tier3.falseShrinebreake.name: False Shrinebreaker Hands
items.gear.armor.tier3.falseShrinebreake.description: A pair of finely woven gloves that seem to glimmer with the ageless suffering of the False Ones.

items.gear.armor.tier3.irmgard.heroIrmga.name: Dasha Mender Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.irmgard.heroIrmga.description: A humble cloak woven by Dasha artisans. Countless pockets give way to countless secrets.

items.gear.armor.tier3.irmgard.heroIrmga.name: Dasha Mender Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier3.irmgard.heroIrmga.description: The Maker disdains flashy adornments. A pair of simple leather pants can suit lords and farmers alike.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.name: Eversol Knight Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.description: The armor of the capital - forged from ore in the mines of Bayscathe, and sculpted in Phalen herself.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.name: Eversol Knight Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.description: A powerful pair of gauntlets. Sculpted from metal so pure they often glint in the sunlight.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.name: Eversol Knight Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.description: The crest of Eversol, the seat of power and nobility.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.name: Eversol Knight Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.heroKnight.description: An immaculate pair of leg guards. Should only be worn by allies and defenders of Phalen.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.name: Umbral Knight's Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.description: The armor of a monk, long dead, who claimed he could hear the earth breathe.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.name: Umbral Knight's Clutch
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.description: Clawed metal gauntlets with lethal hooks forged into the palm.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.name: Umbral Knight's Hollow
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.description: It is said that inside this helm, you can hear the voices of those you've slain, whispering incessantly.

items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.name: Umbral Knight's Poise
items.gear.armor.tier3.knight.umbralKnig.description: A pair of finely-woven leggings that rustle like parchment pages when the wearer moves.

items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.name: Conjurer's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.description: The stylish leather coat of a traveling seer, likely of dubious integrity. No doubt it has had many owners.

items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.name: Conjurer's Leather Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.description: Simple yet elegant leather gloves, of a type favored by mystics and soothsayers from the mainland.

items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.name: Conjurer's Head Wrap
items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.description: When wrapped around the head it provides little protection but is excellent at wicking sweat.

items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.name: Conjurer's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.description: Slim leather trousers, suitable for those more interested in posture and appearance than protection.

items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.name: Vile Conjurer's Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.lanark.heroLanark.description: The coat of a traveling seer, who delved too far into the fell arts of the clerics from Giranoth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.name: Blackhewn Mage's Robes
items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.description: The drapings of a cleric from Blackhewn, on the eastern edge of The Seethe.

items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.name: Blackhewn Mage's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.description: Sewn from a sinister black cloth designed to amplify mystical powers.

items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.name: Blackhewn Mage's Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier3.magetrainer.heroM.description: Although they wear shoes, it is said that the clerics from Blackhewn never touch the ground.

items.gear.armor.tier3.mindcontroller.he.name: The Caretaker's Habit
items.gear.armor.tier3.mindcontroller.he.description: The diseased rags of a former Dasha cleric.

items.gear.armor.tier3.mindcontroller.he.name: The Caretaker's Tatters
items.gear.armor.tier3.mindcontroller.he.description: The religious wrappings of the Dasha faithful, now malign and corrupted.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Outrider Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.description: The most favored armor of the Knights of Tanth. A vibrant, formidable outfit.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Outrider Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.description: Gauntlets rumored to have been blessed by the King of Tanth himself.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Outrider Cap
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.description: Rumor has it the helms of Tanth are dyed with a mixture of saffron and blood.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Outrider Leg Guards
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandB.heroOrlan.description: A pair of greaves forged in the finest (and only) armory on Tanth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandD.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Vanguard Cap
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandD.heroOrlan.description: A crimson helmet forged curiously in the shape of the known world.

items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandE.heroOrlan.name: Tanth Cleaver Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier3.orlandE.heroOrlan.description: Its shape may prevent the wearer from hiding in the bushes; but the Knights of Tanth have no need for stealth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.name: Boarskin Leather Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.description: The sweltering, stinking hide of the Boarskin clan. Best worn by those who have lost their sense of smell.

items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.name: Boarskin Leather Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.description: A filthy jumble of coarse leather in the vague shape of a pair of gloves.

items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.name: Boarskin Leather Hat
items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.description: Any coward can forge a helmet out of metal. For the Boarskin, true glory comes from the wearing of flesh.

items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.name: Boarskin Leather Pants
items.gear.armor.tier3.pigHeadBandit.her.description: Best not to ask whence the leather which made these trousers was sourced.

items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.name: Risen Brightburn Vest
items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.description: A small sect of Risen scholars, now mostly dead, once attempted to harvest the luminous putrescence of the Gloam.

items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.name: Risen Brightburn Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.description: You can tell the hands of a Brightburn by the faintly glowing stains that cover their fingers.

items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.name: Risen Brightburn Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.description: Painted with a glowing rune, evocative and intimidating, but signifying nothing.

items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.name: Risen Brightburn Bones
items.gear.armor.tier3.risenBrightburn.r.description: The faint glowing light never wavers, even as the fabric rots around it.

items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.name: Verdant Warrior Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.description: The vibrant body armor of a mysterious outfit known only as the Order of the Moss.

items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.name: Verdant Warrior Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.description: Bronze, hammered metal, of unknown provenance.

items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.name: Verdant Warrior Helm
items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.description: And my enemies shall tremble before me, and my legend shall grow upon the earth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.name: Verdant Warrior Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.saladKnight.heroS.description: Trousers belonging to one of the elusive, erudite members of the Order of the Moss.

items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.name: Nith Leviathan Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.description: A massive cloak cobbled together from damp hides and fetid rags.

items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.name: Nith Leviathan Skull
items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.description: The most prized adornment of the Nith. A headpiece made of nothing but bone and death.

items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.name: Nith Leviathan Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier3.swampGiant.heroSw.description: If they fit you, you are too tall.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.name: Black Spark Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.description: When they first appeared, The Gloam's iridescent growths caused some to think they had emerged from the sea. But only the blackened earth could dream up something so foul.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.name: Black Spark Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.description: "Hands fumbling in darkness will find only fell deeds."  - saying often heard in Havenport

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.name: Black Spark Runners
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.description: Dancing lights behind you, run fast and never rest. Dancing lights before you, lie down and wait for death.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.name: Black Spark Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.blackSpa.description: A strand of shimmering mold and fungus, twisted into the vague shape of armor.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.name: Bright Walker's Barrier
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.description: You are moving through a darkened cavern, touching the wall for guidance. Then your hand lands upon a wall… that moves.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.name: Bright Walker's Fist
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.description: A heavy gauntlet that can squeeze the life out of darkness itself.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.name: Bright Walker's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.brightWa.description: Some say footfalls in the night add twice the height.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.cavernWr.name: Cavern Wretch Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.cavernWr.description: With The Gloam, it can sometimes be difficult to tell fabric apart from pulsing flesh.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.cavernWr.name: Cavern Wretch Legs
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.cavernWr.description: Wet, festering trousers that have not seen the sun for many seasons.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.name: Dusk Child's Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.description: The cloak of the forgotten Gloam - this is what becomes of the plague in the dark, wet places beneath our feet.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.name: Dusk Child's Flight
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.description: Close your eyes and be quick of step, and you may yet escape the darkness; unlike the former owner of these trousers.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.name: Dusk Child's Trick
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.duskChil.description: Gloves once made of leather, now grown thick with the glinting sinew of The Gloam.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.glintfie.name: Glintfiend Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.glintfie.description: A noble warrior's tunic, unbroken by battle, now coated in shimmering filth.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.glintfie.name: Glintfiend Rags
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.glintfie.description: No one imagined what demented shape the Pestilence could be twisted into by the darkness beneath our feet.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.name: Gloamking Armor
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.description: There is more to fear beneath the ground than merely death and darkness.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.name: Gloamking Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.description: The glistening armor of a warrior for whom dying to the Pestilence was only the beginning.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.name: Gloamking Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.gloamkin.description: If your eyes fail you, but your ears behold the clank of heavy iron footfalls in the dark… Run.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.name: Torchborne Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.description: Dank, fetid trousers that still bear a trace of their former owner's sickly luminescence.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.name: Torchborne Crest
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.description: There are few who venture into the deep places beneath Sacra anymore. Of those who do, the sight they most fear is a beautiful, dancing light in the darkness.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.name: Torchborne Grip
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.description: Heavy leather gloves, once belonging to a man, but now taken from a cave-dwelling wraith.

items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.name: Torchborne Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier3.theGloam.torchbor.description: Certain scholars have attempted to examine the luminous growths that afflict The Gloam. Certain scholars are rarely seen again

items.gear.armor.tier4.arenaMaster.conqu.name: Conqueror of the Arena
items.gear.armor.tier4.arenaMaster.conqu.description: Only a champion deserves to wear such finery! A warrior of peerless skill, a legend without equal! Are you such a warrior?

items.gear.armor.tier4.arenaMaster.conqu.name: Conqueror's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier4.arenaMaster.conqu.description: The pants of one who has heard the hush of the crowd, felt the dust of the arena, and tasted the blood of victory.

items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.name: Crestfallen Knight Body Armor
items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.description: As rigid and unflinching as its former owner's will.

items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.name: Crestfallen Knight Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.description: A pair of hammered gauntlets, bleached bright from years of battle.

items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.name: Crestfallen Knight Helm
items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.description: A formidable helmet that will block out most attacks, as well as sunlight and clean air.

items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.name: Crestfallen Knight Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier4.banditArmored.her.description: Thick and loud, these are not the leg guards of a subtle warrior.

items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearBody.name: Ironfur Hide
items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearBody.description: Winter in the Frozen Peaks can be brutal. A thick hide is essential for survival.

items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearGlov.name: Ironfur Claws
items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearGlov.description: Thick gloves that once belonged to a hermit of the eastern mountains.

items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearHelm.name: Ironfur Mantle
items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearHelm.description: The fearsome crown of a champion hunter. To best the beast, one must become the beast.

items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearPant.name: Ironfur Steps
items.gear.armor.tier4.bear.heroBearPant.description: When snow falls thickly, so the leather of one's breeches must thicken as well.

items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsC.name: Grifkin's Coat
items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsC.description: A thick, warm coat belonging to one of the deranged "goat men" of northern Sacra. (Sworn enemies of the Balak Taw.)

items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsH.name: Grifkin's Horns
items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsH.description: It is rumored that to come of age, members of the Grifkin must kill a goat with their bare hands, and then live inside it for a week.

items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsL.name: Grifkin's Legs
items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsL.description: A rough-hewn pair of leggings designed to blur the line between animal and man.

items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsM.name: Grifkin's Mitts
items.gear.armor.tier4.goatman.grifkinsM.description: For keeping the flesh warm in high mountain regions, nothing beats the fur of an Alpine Goat.

items.gear.armor.tier4.kingHarol.royalBo.name: Bolein Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier4.kingHarol.royalBo.description: A coat of fine threads and lustrous feathers, fit for the House that rules the empire.

items.gear.armor.tier4.kingHarol.royalBo.name: Bolein Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier4.kingHarol.royalBo.description: No royal is born so high that he is above the need for pants.

items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerBody.name: Seer's Robes
items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerBody.description: Drapings that may appear simple and ragged; but they are infused with dark purpose.

items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerGlov.name: Seer's Hands
items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerGlov.description: Soft gloves that have been dipped in mold and bathed in the blackness of the night sky.

items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerHelm.name: Seer's Cap
items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerHelm.description: A wide-brimmed hat of unknown provenance, steeped in fell magic.

items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerPant.name: Seer's Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier4.seer.heroSeerPant.description: Lightweight pants that smell faintly of thick, wet earth.

items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.name: Taleweaver's Cape
items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.description: The uniform of a high-born noble of Tir; but it has been stripped of its crest, and worn tired with time.

items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.name: Taleweaver's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.description: A refined pair of leather gloves, hand-made by one of the elite artisans of Upper Tir.

items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.name: Taleweaver's Legs
items.gear.armor.tier4.winnick.heroWinni.description: Trousers made for a nobleman in the valley beyond the Frozen Peaks.

items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.name: Bolein Knight Armor
items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.description: The uniform of the ruling House in Phalen, until recently led by King Harol.

items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.name: Bolein Knight Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.description: As the knight keeps a firm grip on his spear, so House Bolein maintains a firm grip on the throne.

items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.name: Bolein Knight Helmet
items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.description: It is said that no matter where you are, one can always see the dawn sun glinting off the helm of a Bolein Knight.

items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.name: Bolein Knight Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier5.boleinKnight.hero.description: They march through the streets of Phalen, for order, for victory, for God.

items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.name: Prince of Lies
items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.description: A magnificent suit of armor, acquired strictly by honorable means.

items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.name: Liar's Gauntlets
items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.description: Always watch the hand you aren't shaking.

items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.name: Liar's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier5.channing.heroChan.description: They're worth more than you paid for them, honest.

items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.name: Knellap's Puffery
items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.description: None seem able to find Knellap on any map or scroll, but don't tell that to its defenders.

items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.name: Knellap's Talons
items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.description: These gloves fight for justice, however misguided and deranged that justice might be.

items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.name: Knellap's Comb
items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.description: Defenders of Knellap fight with the pride of the cock, the patience of the hen, the fury of the flock.

items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.name: Knellap's March
items.gear.armor.tier5.chicken.heroChick.description: Leggings meant for straddling a spit of land, planting a flag, and declaring it liberated.

items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksBo.name: Ashen Tunic
items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksBo.description: A cloak that wields sadness as armor, and despair as a weapon.

items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksHe.name: Ashen Hood
items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksHe.description: When a true warrior looks inward, she sees only blackness. And when she looks outward, she sees only fear.

items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksPa.name: Ashen Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier5.hicks.heroHicksPa.description: Quick leather pants, woven in secret. Worn in haste.

items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.name: Inquisitor's Robes
items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.description: This holy cloak is placed upon one's shoulders by God's many hands, and enfolds the wearer as if it were the Embrace itself.

items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.name: Inquisitor's Grip
items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.description: May the many hands move through yours, and may your grasp be everywhere at once.

items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.name: Inquisitor's Cowl
items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.description: We do not need the eyes that were born into our skull. For the many eyes of the all-knowing will show us who we truly are.

items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.name: Inquisitor's Stance
items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.heroIn.description: Hammered out of pure white gold in the holy smith of Phalen; only the embraced may wear these greaves.

items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.speake.name: Speaker's Eyes
items.gear.armor.tier5.inquisitor.speake.description: It is said that the Inquisition's elite sometimes abandon the use of their eyes altogether; for the hands of God will show them all they need to see.

items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.name: Royal Cloak
items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.description: None may wear this cape save the Lords of House Bolein. Anyone else who should dare must be a fool or a traitor.

items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.name: Royal Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.description: White gloves woven of silk so fine that it surpasses the comfort of one's own skin.

items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.name: Royal Leggings
items.gear.armor.tier5.magnus.heroMagnus.description: The finest breeches made by the finest tailor in the finest city in the realm.

items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.name: Bolein Rebel's Armor
items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.description: Sometimes on the battlefield you meet your enemy. And sometimes you meet your destiny.

items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.name: Bolein Rebel's Fists
items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.description: We cannot conquer the past. But we can wield it to serve the future.

items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.name: Bolein Rebel's Stance
items.gear.armor.tier5.odessaBattle.hero.description: The mark of a true leader is knowing when to stride into battle, and when to sit down and think.

items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.name: Armor of the Cleanse
items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.description: The last pure robes left on Sacra. Stained with the blackened tears of those who have been cured.

items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.name: Hands of the Cleanse
items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.description: A pair of gloves stitched with a single purpose - to rid the world of sickness.

items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.name: Eyes of the Cleanse
items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.description: True rot lies in the eye of the beholder.

items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.name: Path of the Cleanse
items.gear.armor.tier5.plagueDoctor.hero.description: The healer's work is never done. There is always a next town waiting to be cured.

items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanBody.name: Apprentice's Coat
