items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanBody.description: An academic's ensemble which primarily supports the carrying of as many books as possible.

items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanGlov.name: Apprentice's Gloves
items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanGlov.description: Soft gloves with some of the tips worn thin, from being licked to turn pages.

items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanHelm.name: Apprentice's Hat
items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanHelm.description: "The flame of inspiration must be constantly tended." - Tir proverb

items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanPant.name: Apprentice's Trousers
items.gear.armor.tier5.roan.heroRoanPant.description: Leather trousers, washed infrequently. The pursuit of knowledge must not be interrupted.

items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.name: Ashen Knight Armor
items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.description: Whether a crusader's purpose be foul or noble, there will always be black deeds that must be done in the name of victory.

items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.name: Ashen Knight Claws
items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.description: Armored fingers made of toughest iron; it's no coincidence they resemble the crooked hand of a skeleton.

items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.name: Ashen Knight Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.description: An elite pair of leg guards, forged black as night and outfitted with lethal toe talons.

items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.name: Ashen Knight Mask
items.gear.armor.tier6.aedra.ashenKnight.description: "And the reach of God's many hands will be like a great golden flame, billowing up into the darkness."  - Madrigal Erinth

items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.masterOfTr.name: Master of Trades
items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.masterOfTr.description: "Good business is knowing the business of others." -overheard in Havenport

items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.mastersCuf.name: Master's Cuffs
items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.mastersCuf.description: When the Lords of Eversol shake hands, it is said that the truth passes between their palms, even as their lips speak lies.

items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.mastersGre.name: Master's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier6.baurus.mastersGre.description: Leg guards belonging to a Lord of House Orland. Woe betide the thief who is caught wearing them.

items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.name: Broken Vow's Mantle
items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.description: Adorned with blackened skulls, it seems that the judgment of its mysterious owner is always death.

items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.name: Broken Vow's Grasp
items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.description: Caked with soot and salt, did its former owner step from the sea or climb out of the bowels of the earth?

items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.name: Broken Vow's Helm
items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.description: These glowing eyes are a false moon, a deadly beckoning. What the candle says to the moth.

items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.name: Broken Vow's Greaves
items.gear.armor.tier6.executioner.heroE.description: These greaves match the bootprints left in the caved-in chests of Risen and Sacrament Guards alike.

items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.name: Planeswalker Breeches
items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.description: A luxurious pair of trousers "retrieved" from some distant corner of the Far Lands.

items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.name: Planeswalker Crown
items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.description: Yes, the bird comes with it.

items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.name: Planeswalker Knuckles
items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.description: An oddly-hewn set of gauntlets that seem to offer little physical protection - but their strength may not be visible to the naked eye.

items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.name: Planeswalker Robes
items.gear.armor.tier6.finley.planeswalk.description: A garment that some claim was stitched together out of threads from beyond the known realms of existence.

items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.name: Reaper's Shroud
items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.description: The black cloth of this death cult seems to swallow all light, even in the midst of the day.

items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.name: Reaper's Clutch
items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.description: How many bodies have gone cold beneath the pitiless squeeze of these gloves?

items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.name: Reaper's Grimace
items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.description: The Reapers wear a mask of death - their god, their purpose, their gift to the world.

items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.name: Reaper's Footfalls
items.gear.armor.tier6.grimReaper.heroGr.description: The Reapers move quiet as the grave, which is the one true home they seek to deliver us all to.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.name: Seraph's Robes
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.description: Inquisitors, Seraphs, and Keepers all share one thing in common - they serve the Madrigal.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.name: Seraph's Reach
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.description: Let the hands of God enfold your mind. And you will realize that you have always been Embraced.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.name: Seraph's Cowl
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.description: There are some churches sprinkled around the realm whose doors mysteriously never open. No one but the Inquisition knows their true purpose.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.name: Seraph's Feet
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorBlack.h.description: All paths lead to the Embrace.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.name: Keeper's Embrace
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.description: It is said that the holy Keepers never speak, for there is no word as swift as God's wrath.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.name: Keeper's Eyes
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.description: No one has ever seen a Keeper without its helm. In fact some say they are empty; and God himself gazes out through the many eyes.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.name: Keeper's Stride
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.description: A Madrigal's Keeper leaves no footsteps, for God's hands carry them wherever they go.

items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.name: Keeper's Talons
items.gear.armor.tier6.inquisitorElite.k.description: The luminous gloves of one who gave his life to protect his Madrigal - the sacred dream of every Keeper.

items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.cloakOfThe.name: Cloak of the Primus
items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.cloakOfThe.description: The official armor of the elite leaders of the Knights of House Bolein. Few and fervent are those who earn the right to wear it.

items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.fealtyOfTh.name: Fealty of the Primus
items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.fealtyOfTh.description: The Knights of House Bolein are the pillars upon which Phalen stands tall.

items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.gripOfTheP.name: Grip of the Primus
items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.gripOfTheP.description: The glove of a soldier knows only how to clutch a weapon. But the glove of a leader knows how to shake the enemy's hand.

items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.helmOfTheP.name: Helm of the Primus
items.gear.armor.tier6.silvio.helmOfTheP.description: It is said the plumage on the helm of a Primus comes from the rare pheasants that are bred in the king's private garden.

items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.name: Armor of Silence
items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.description: We are born in a roar. We must die in the quiet.

items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.name: Gauntlets of Silence
items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.description: Words cannot be grasped, but weapons can.

items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.name: Helm of Silence
items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.description: Speak only purpose, and reap only quiet. The Sayer hears our deeds.

items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.name: Greaves of Silence
items.gear.armor.tier6.spiderHorseman.he.description: No name shall be called, no words shall be spoken. But my footfalls you will hear.

items.gear.offHands.bowguns.reinforcedBo.name: Reinforced Bowgun
items.gear.offHands.bowguns.reinforcedBo.description: A weapon of graceless efficiency. Archers and knights look down on it, until you're looking down on them.

items.gear.offHands.bows.answeredPrayer.name: Answered Prayer
items.gear.offHands.bows.answeredPrayer.description: It's said a betrayed archer spent years hunting down her former allies and impaling their skulls on her bow.

items.gear.offHands.bows.balakTalon.name: Balak Talon
items.gear.offHands.bows.balakTalon.description: Lined with a hush of rare feathers, this bow seems to vanish when leaned against a tree.

items.gear.offHands.bows.fungusStrungBow.name: Fungus Strung Bow
items.gear.offHands.bows.fungusStrungBow.description: Arrows loosed from it always seem to grow something where they land.

items.gear.offHands.bows.lacqueredBow.name: Lacquered Bow
items.gear.offHands.bows.lacqueredBow.description: The Archers of Halheim say a bow must be held as if it were the nape of an animal's neck. Tender, and gentle - but ready to send a message at any moment.

items.gear.offHands.bows.paleAsh.name: Pale Ash
items.gear.offHands.bows.paleAsh.description: A bow of eerie white that never seems to dirty - mud and blood alike slide off it like water.

items.gear.offHands.bows.patience.name: Patience
items.gear.offHands.bows.patience.description: The woodland bow of a hunter so patient, moss eventually overgrew him, leaving only the bow behind.

items.gear.offHands.bows.shortBow.name: Short Bow
items.gear.offHands.bows.shortBow.description: A short ranged bow for novice archers or those wishing to remain discrete.

items.gear.offHands.bows.sirensCall.name: Siren's Call
items.gear.offHands.bows.sirensCall.description: When strung, it hums just above hearing. Some archers report strange dreams and uncanny aim.

items.gear.offHands.bows.twinedRecurveBo.name: Twined Recurve Bow
items.gear.offHands.bows.twinedRecurveBo.description: A bow of unconventional design that musters up considerable strength from its short draw.

items.gear.offHands.bows.twinklingShortB.name: Twinkling Short Bow
items.gear.offHands.bows.twinklingShortB.description: A short bow polished to a mirror sheen - for archers swift enough that they don't care about being spotted.

items.gear.offHands.bows.woodlandProtect.name: Woodland Protector
items.gear.offHands.bows.woodlandProtect.description: Made from the antlers of a whole herd of deer, it brings luck only to those who hunt for food, not sport.

items.gear.offHands.bows.yewLongbow.name: Yew Longbow
items.gear.offHands.bows.yewLongbow.description: Strong yet lissome, some say a yew bow won’t fire unless the shot feeds a stomach or ends a monster.

items.gear.offHands.hooks.jawGutter.name: Jaw Gutter
items.gear.offHands.hooks.jawGutter.description: The ghastly hook of the Deadtide's leader, who was driven mad by the fumes of a plagued whale carcass.

items.gear.offHands.lights.BloomedBell.name: Bloomed Bell
items.gear.offHands.lights.BloomedBell.description: A heavy lantern enwreathed in strange growths. They seem to feed off the light within.

items.gear.offHands.lights.Lantern.name: Lantern
items.gear.offHands.lights.Lantern.description: A light in darkness, a pool of warmth in the cold. Many mistake its glow for safety.

items.gear.offHands.lights.MorbidWayfind.name: Morbid Wayfinder
items.gear.offHands.lights.MorbidWayfind.description: A lantern carved out of a human skull that still manages to light the way... only the way towards what?

items.gear.offHands.lights.simpleTorch.name: Simple Torch
items.gear.offHands.lights.simpleTorch.description: Held in left hand, brightens dark areas. Time-limited usage, <color=#F2E6BD>loses durability over time</color> while equipped.

items.gear.offHands.orbs.frigidSkull.name: Frigid Skull
items.gear.offHands.orbs.frigidSkull.description: The skull of a traveler who froze to death amid icy peaks - you can still hear the wind howl through its sockets.

items.gear.offHands.quivers.blastingQuiv.name: Blasting Quiver
items.gear.offHands.quivers.blastingQuiv.description: Allows the wielder to fire <color=#F2E6BD>explosive arrows</color> with a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color>.

items.gear.offHands.quivers.blightedQuiv.name: Blighted Quiver
items.gear.offHands.quivers.blightedQuiv.description: Allows the wielder to fire <color=#F2E6BD>blighted arrows</color> when equipped with a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color>.

items.gear.offHands.quivers.freezingQuiv.name: Freezing Quiver
items.gear.offHands.quivers.freezingQuiv.description: Allows the wielder to fire <color=#F2E6BD>frost arrows</color> when equipped with a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color>.

items.gear.offHands.quivers.shockingQuiv.name: Shocking Quiver
items.gear.offHands.quivers.shockingQuiv.description: Allows the wielder to fire <color=#F2E6BD>lightning arrows</color> when equipped with a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color>.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Cerulean Hightower
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: Sometimes a battle is like a verbal joust, with barbs traded back and forth. This ends the conversation.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Crimson Guard
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: A formidable shield, dyed red for one very specific reason.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Falstead's Barricade
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: The leader of the Risen has seen the glint of just about every blade on Sacra. But none have ever passed this wall.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: From the Ashes
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: The sigil of House Bolein reminds us there is no rebirth without death, and for one body to be warmed, another must be burned.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Glacial Greatshield
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: A greatshield forged in the mines of Tir. As timeless and immovable as the mountain herself.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Heraldic Crest Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: May glory be found upon the open seas, and may God's embrace be found in death.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Keeper's Grasp
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: The last defense of the Inquisition, emblazoned with the reach of the one true God.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Oaken Tower
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: In your attacks, be as swift as the wind. In your defense, be as solid as a tree.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Risen Pavise
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: For the Risen, the leviathan symbolizes the people – long dormant, but mighty when woken by the abuses of those in power.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Rotwall
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: The Gloam burrows through flesh and bone and caverns of stone - why would steel be any different?

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Serenity
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: A powerful shield hammered by a reclusive cult of druids from Waithe, about which little is known.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Serpentguard
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: The undulating formations of Seethe regiments have been known to confuse if not outright dizzy opposing troops.

items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.name: Wrath's Voice
items.gear.offHands.shields.greatshields.description: A grotesque barrier of unknown origin. May God forgive the wretch who wields it.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Bandit's Targe
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: A shield like any other, only more so.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Battered Buckler
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: Every divot on this shield is a mark of glory. Until the one that pierces it through.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Glimmering Bulwark
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: A shield polished and buffed until your enemies can see themselves in it. Do them the kindness of offering a closer look.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Studded Buckler
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: A pockmarked circle of steel offering a thin veil of protection.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Wooden Howler
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: Defend yourself with the ferocity of a lion; or else flee with the haste of a stag.

items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.name: Wooden Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.lightShields.description: Only the most desperate of times should pit weathered wood against steel weapons.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Arcane Sentinel Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: In a land of giants and monsters, some armorers consider it poor form to paint a beast of imagination, lest it might spring to life.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Azure Phoenix Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: For her soldiers, House Bolein and the Empire are one and the same. Arrogant perhaps, but not inaccurate.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Barred Entry
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: "A good shield is like a doorway to the heart. It must never be opened."  -Lorig the Blacksmith

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Bearheart Guard
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: The symbol of Sacrament. The color of an uncertain dawn. The hope to survive just one more day.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Blazoned Rivershield
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: "Catch a fish, catch a cold, catch a secret 'fore you're told" - Havenport children's song

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Eye of the Beholder
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: A rare and unusual shield not forged in Phalen, despite its prominent eye. Rumors say it was hammered by a mad tinker somewhere in the Shattered Hand.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Family Crest
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: An elegant shield bearing the sigil of a long-forgotten family, most likely from Thorn.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Gloried Barricade
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: Bright like the boldness of the morning sky. Unyielding like the spirit of the great House Wallace.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Heart's Desire
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: The shield of an adolescent squire, one who has yet to take a life on the battlefield.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Immortal Nest
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: A powerful shield rumored to be the demented creation of a Balak Taw warlord - but no one knows for sure.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Kite Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: A sleek and swift defender, one of the finest of its kind - but beaten ragged from years of battle.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Maiden's Voyage
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: An elegant kite shield forged in Phalen and brought to Sacra as an heirloom of the Bolein family.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Mariner's Aegis
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: A popular rumor among sailors is there's only one substance that can protect a shield against saltwater rust.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Radiant Star
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: Marauders from Thorn are said to summon the four corners of the compass in battle - courage from the west; cunning from the east; fury from the south; and despair from the north.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Round Shield
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: Compact and colorful, built to feel like part of your arm.

items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.name: Scale of Justice
items.gear.offHands.shields.mediumShield.description: Whether the bearer of this shield prevails, or falls in battle; it is meant to be.

items.gear.offHands.whips.plagueWhip.name: Plague Whip
items.gear.offHands.whips.plagueWhip.description: "Sickness makes a noise. And it's not a moan or a hiss - it's a ghastly CRACK." - unknown deathbed ravings

items.gear.rings.agilityRing.name: Agility Ring
items.gear.rings.agilityRing.description: "Our final death is a debt owed. Each small death is a payment toward it." - Elegy of the Silent

items.gear.rings.bandOfCalmness.name: Band of Calmness
items.gear.rings.bandOfCalmness.description: "The eternal gods know only the world as it was, the Born God sees the world as it could be." - Litany of Hope

items.gear.rings.battlecryRing.name: Battlecry Ring
items.gear.rings.battlecryRing.description: "Let their screams be our battle cry. Let their whimpers be our last words." - Elegy of the Unspoken

items.gear.rings.crowRing.name: Crow Ring
items.gear.rings.crowRing.description: "All things fester. Flesh to fluid. Bone to dust. You to this. To us." - Prayer of Rot

items.gear.rings.featherRing.name: Feather Ring
items.gear.rings.featherRing.description: "Part the branches and steady the wind, oh Seeker, so that I may take flight." - Hymn of Freedom

items.gear.rings.fierceRing.name: Fierce Ring
items.gear.rings.fierceRing.description: "The Born God sees through our eyes, acts through our hands. He is countless, he is legion." - Litany of Union

items.gear.rings.goldenBand.name: Golden Band
items.gear.rings.goldenBand.description: "Our god is the Born God. Not the first god, but the last. Not the question, but the answer." - Litany of Origin

items.gear.rings.jadeRing.name: Jade Ring
items.gear.rings.jadeRing.description: "The Born God subsumed the kingdom of gods, now our duty is to subsume the kingdom of men." - Litany of Duty

items.gear.rings.plaguedRing.name: Plagued Ring
items.gear.rings.plaguedRing.description: "Feel unwell. Feel nothing. Feel this blessing of decay." - Prayer of Sickness

items.gear.rings.ringOfBrokenPromises.name: Ring of Broken Promises
items.gear.rings.ringOfBrokenPromises.description: "We are mother to the plague and child to it. We eat our young. We eat our old." - Elegy of the Empty

items.gear.rings.ringOfDetermination.name: Ring of Determination
items.gear.rings.ringOfDetermination.description: "The Born God knew you in the beforelife, as he will again in the afterlife. Are you worth knowing?" -  Litany of Fealty

items.gear.rings.runeRing.name: Rune Ring
items.gear.rings.runeRing.description: "The Sayer speaks for us. So we cloak ourselves in silence." - Elegy of the None

items.gear.rings.scarletRing.name: Scarlet Ring
items.gear.rings.scarletRing.description: "They want what you have. They are what you want. Take." -  Prayer of Betrayal

items.gear.rings.serendipityRing.name: Serendipity Ring
items.gear.rings.serendipityRing.description: "We grow, we build, we search, we pass. But only with all four do we live." - Hymn of Four

items.gear.rings.silverRing.name: Silver Ring
items.gear.rings.silverRing.description: "A name is a weakness. A voice is a vice. We have neither." - Elegy of the Hushed

items.gear.rings.snakeRing.name: Snake Ring
items.gear.rings.snakeRing.description: "Eat the moving. Feast upon the still. All is hunger." - Prayer of Appetite

items.gear.rings.solaceRing.name: Solace Ring
items.gear.rings.solaceRing.description: "Look away, oh Forsaken, I am not ready." - Hymn of Loss

items.gear.rings.stoneTuskRing.name: Stone Tusk Ring
items.gear.rings.stoneTuskRing.description: "All practice our faith, even if they do not know its name. There are no infidels, only heretics." - Litany of Embrace

items.gear.rings.thistleRing.name: Thistle Ring
items.gear.rings.thistleRing.description: "You have been wronged. You have been curdled. They must hurt for it." - Prayer of Agony

items.gear.rings.willowCapRing.name: Willow Cap Ring
items.gear.rings.willowCapRing.description: "Place your lips to the earth, oh Mother, and breathe warmth into my harvest." - Hymn of Growth

items.gear.rings.wovenRing.name: Woven Ring
items.gear.rings.wovenRing.description: "Thread your fingers through my own, oh Maker, and shape the clay of my becoming." - Hymn of Form

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.boarskin.name: Boarskin Tusk
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.boarskin.description: Favored by the Boarskin clan, this rugged axe features a jagged edge mimicking the ferocity of a wild boar's tusks.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.huntersA.name: Hunter's Axe
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.huntersA.description: A simple axe carried by hunters to make a fast shelter or a faster kill.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.jadeSpin.name: Jade-Spined Axe
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.jadeSpin.description: "May the grass grow over your bones" - a blessing and a curse uttered by the tribesmen bearing this axe.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.ripper.name: Ripper
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.ripper.description: A battle axe, well-worn but still sharp. It has cleaved many men and seen what lies within.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.royalHew.name: Royal Hewn Axe
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.royalHew.description: The jagged edges of this axe are a particular cruelty, and a reminder of the cost of crossing Phalen.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.shroudcl.name: Shroudcleaver
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.shroudcl.description: In your hands it feels light as a feather, sunk into your foe’s skull it feels heavy as the hereafter.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.timberRe.name: Reclaimer
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.timberRe.description: Some claim the Harvesters growl “timber” when they cleave a man in two, a vestige of their old selves buried beneath their madness.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.tongueSp.name: Tongue Splitter
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.axes.tongueSp.description: Designed by Royal Executioner Rochel himself, ideal for deaths delivered without hesitation nor mercy.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.blacksm.name: Blacksmith’s Folly
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.blacksm.description: Its few surviving victims argue over what’s worse – the going in or the pulling back out.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.harvest.name: Harvester's Bonesaw
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.harvest.description: Pray that the screams of its victims drown out the wet grinding crunch of its progress.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.nailLad.name: Nail-Laden Club
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.nailLad.description: A weapon for those in desperate times. Swing first, swing hard, and hope for the best.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.ogresCl.name: Ogre's Club
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.ogresCl.description: It is like the life of man: nasty, brutish, and short.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.unholyH.name: Unholy Hearth
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.clubs.unholyH.description: Not all fires bring warmth – some offer instead an everlasting cold.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Buried Shamshir
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: The ancient method of its forging saw it buried in sand for forty nights. Modern blacksmiths eschew this step.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Cerulean Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: The "eye" affixed to its cross guard is more than decorative - it's a counterbalance for precise strikes.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Demon's Key
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: This sword's forked point serves no purpose other than brutality. But, at times, brutality is a purpose.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Etched Yatagan
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: Legend says if you carve the name of your enemy into its hilt, it will only shatter upon their demise.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Filleter
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: A fisherman's blade, it severs cleanly and without fuss.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Risen Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: A well-weighted scimitar of simple design commonly seen dangling from Risen belts.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Rusty Khopesh
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: The Grifkin goat men model these blades after ram horns - ideal for swift disembowelings.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Scimitar
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: Upon joining the Sailor's Guild, one is issued a compass, an Ashen Sea map, and a scimitar. All will be used.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..name: Talwar
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.curvedSwords..description: The weapon of choice for knights of the now-disgraced House of Mar'quat.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.aSing.name: A Singular Purpose
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.aSing.description: A well-crafted dagger is the great leveler - it slides equally into the bellies of drunks and backs of kings.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.butch.name: Butcher's Work
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.butch.description: One grieves for even the animals laid to rest with such a twisted blade.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.hunte.name: Hunter's Knife
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.hunte.description: A simple, versatile knife preferred by hunters. If there is a job to be done, it will do it.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.jackk.name: Jackknife
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.jackk.description: "A knife is like a poor secret, whispered deep and often." - old proverb

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.midni.name: Midnight Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.daggers.midni.description: The assassins of Myrfall are said to carry such blades, to make short work of those judged unworthy of living.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.broke.name: Broken Forge
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.broke.description: It's tradition to use the remnants of an exhausted forge to make one final, monstrous hammer.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.bruta.name: Brutal Maul
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.bruta.description: It splits stone and skulls alike - a mountain of purpose focused on a single point.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.climb.name: Climber's Pick
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.climb.description: They can be seen dotting the Frozen Peaks, memorials to those who gave their life to the climb.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.grima.name: Grimacing Stone
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.grima.description: It is unknown if the stone was chiseled into the face of a man, or if a man's skull was transformed into stone.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.rosto.name: Rostock
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.rosto.description: An unsually supple hammer said to originate from the blind Stone Tappers of The Seethe.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.singi.name: Singing Peal
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.hammers.singi.description: Once a year, a troupe of Havenport bards use this hammer for music. The other 364 days its use is violence.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.clerics.name: Cleric's Mace
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.clerics.description: A tool of "re-education" often used by the more enthusiastic of Caylen's devotees.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.malice.name: Malice
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.malice.description: Some weapons blur the line between instrument of war and instrument of torture.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.shrikeT.name: Shrike Tree
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.shrikeT.description: The Balak Taw learn all the worst lessons from their winged brothers - such as how to impale an enemy.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.theLast.name: The Last Word
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.maces.theLast.description: Only once the silence is complete - one crushing blow at a time - will the Cerim's task be fulfilled.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.moons.name: Moonshaft
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.moons.description: Shaped in a "cold stone forge," they're said to strike faster beneath the glow of the moon.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.pigSt.name: Pig Sticker
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.pigSt.description: A blacksmith's wife caught her husband cheating and used one to skewer him toe to crown. The name stuck.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.reach.name: Reaching Nail
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.reach.description: The Morgana "Mud Men" Uprising saw much use of these wicked spikes of iron, pin-cushioning Atlan knights.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.sinew.name: Sinew
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.sinew.description: A rapier of such surgical precision that some claim they can feel a slight tug of it pulling toward a foe's heart.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.siren.name: Siren Queen's Horn
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.siren.description: A blade forged from the severed horn of a Siren Queen, a creature rarely seen and almost never survived.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.tucke.name: Tucked Falcon
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.rapiers.tucke.description: A falcon relies not on subterfuge not guile, but speed alone. This blade is no different.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.assega.name: Assegai
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.assega.description: The men of Arvos use these spears both to keep enemies at bay and test the sinking sands' depth.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.coralP.name: Coral Piercer
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.coralP.description: A spear of Kylesh design, where emeralds litter the island shoals like iridescent boulders.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.gnarle.name: Gnarled Harpoon
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.gnarle.description: A rustic harpoon designed to bury itself in a whale's hide and not let go.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.needle.name: Needle Spear
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.needle.description: A common spear, simple but effective, often carried by the Sworn Guards of Sacrament.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.petale.name: Petaled Spear
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.petale.description: Its fluted tip is as pleasing to the eye as it is damaging to any tissue it penetrates.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.proudl.name: Proud Lance
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.proudl.description: A wedged jousting lance meant for splintering shields and the bones they protect.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.sacram.name: Sacrament's Sin
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.spears.sacram.description: Eight of these spears plunged into the 26th Governor of Sacrament at once, executing her for her crimes.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Azure Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: Imperfections in steel traditionally lead to weakness, but this sword's blend of twin metals imparts strength.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Blood-Rusted Sword
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: Rusted by blood and weary from death, this sword carries out its duty with grim purpose.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Cronus
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: A cursed weapon reputed to hold its victims' souls eternally in the moment of their demise.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Governor's Dagger
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: The governor's short sword serves as a promise - to keep his aspirations and his enemies in striking distance.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Governor's Sword
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: The governor's long sword serves as a reminder - to seek peace by any means necessary, including war.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Nith Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: It reeks of the swamp's wretched bargain - a fast death by blade or a slow one by sickness.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Scorched Broadblade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: A great slab of a sword etched with the stories of an unknown, long dead people.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Spirit Edge
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: All of the forest's fury sealed within a blade of pure light. Glowing wisps drift from its surface like willow branches.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Whetted Wedge
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: Some swords seek out the tiniest of openings, while others carve their own.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.name: Wooden Sword
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.straightSword.description: A training sword for a squire - used in combat only by the overconfident, the deranged, or those in dire straits.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.To.name: Tortured Blade
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.To.description: A decayed and pitted sword, blackened by the dark deeds of former masters.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.co.name: Coiled Dawn
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.co.description: A sword that strikes swift as a viper, the air hissing as it's riven.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.ho.name: Honed Frenzy
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.ho.description: A sword from the isle of Thorn - you can still smell the saltwater in its hilt.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.wi.name: Wind of Death
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wakizashis.wi.description: This wickedly long blade is meant to end a fight before a foe has a chance to start one.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.allIsKn.name: All Is Known
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.allIsKn.description: Everything has a price. Even knowledge. Especially knowledge.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.amberhu.name: Amberhusk
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.amberhu.description: As the rank mass dribbles away, so too does the wand’s potency, leaving only the stain of sweetness.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.crooked.name: Crooked Key
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.crooked.description: Some doors, once opened, can be hard to shut.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.entwine.name: Entwined Root
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.entwine.description: The more gnarled the tree, the more magic one might find entangled in its roots.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.flameBe.name: Flame Becomes Us
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.flameBe.description: A strange assemblage of mystical totems, unified only by the dark will of its wielder.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.fusedCo.name: Fused Coronet
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.fusedCo.description: All wands are hungry. It’s up to its wielder to determine for what.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.graspin.name: Grasping Magus Wand
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.graspin.description: The Born God has many hands – see what damage just one can do.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.hoarFro.name: Hoar Frost Sickle
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.hoarFro.description: On the Isle of Kull, wheat is ice-shorn with these mystic wands – threshed and frozen for winter in a single swing.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.lordOfT.name: Lord of the Muck
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.lordOfT.description: All wands are unholy, but those made from human remains dally with the most wretched of forces.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.moltenC.name: Molten Clutch
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.moltenC.description: The embers should burn its branches. The branches should crush the embers. Magic abhors reason.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.moonSha.name: Moon Shard
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.moonSha.description: It's not your reflection you see in its cracked visage, it's a small sliver of yourself lost forever.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.nithGat.name: Nith Gate
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.nithGat.description: “One hitch to tie your garter, one weave to warm your bed. One stitch to hold the dark at bay, one knot to crack your head.” - nursery rhyme

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.runeStr.name: Rune-Stricken Wand
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.runeStr.description: Put your ear to this wand, and you’ll hear dark whispers. Put your eye to it, and you’ll never see again.

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.sanglie.name: Sanglier
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.sanglie.description: What magic simmered in the head of a plagued boar? And what sick soul saw fit to craft with it?

items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.tarnish.name: Tarnished Wand
items.gear.weapons.1Handed.wands.tarnish.description: In the Phalen religion, magic is blasphemy, so the church’s more mystical adherents simply practice “acts of faith.”

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.curvedGreatsw.name: Divine Scimitar
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.curvedGreatsw.description: A weapon once radiant with holy purpose now worn down to a fine sinew of steel.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.curvedGreatsw.name: Sunbeam
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.curvedGreatsw.description: The raiders of Darshem only attack at noon, holding these swords aloft to blind enemies with their shine.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.name: Ash Soothed Daggers
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.description: Ashes from the forge are rubbed into their surface, dulling their shine but sharpening their point.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.name: Bleeder's Delight
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.description: Daggers designed for rapid, deep punctures to desanguinate with ease.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.name: Brothers Keepers
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.description: "Which blade will stand watch while the other sleeps? Neither, my blades never rest." - old Kylesh proverb

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.name: Chipped Daggers
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.description: It's a cruel irony that the more a dagger decays, the more viciously it tears into flesh.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.name: Rogue Messer
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.doubleDaggers.description: A rogue's dagger should be forged as a rogue's life is lived - not too short, not too long, and ending swiftly.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cla.name: Claw of the Crescent Moon
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cla.description: When a body is discovered at daybreak with three deep rents down its back, authorities know to leave well enough alone.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cry.name: Crystal Fist
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cry.description: A diamond is harder than bone, and it’s happy to prove it.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cur.name: Cursed Unguis
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.cur.description: Long ago a forgotten warrior made a dark bargain, trading flesh for power. This is all that remains.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.dea.name: Deadfang
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.dea.description: Late at night, when the world is quiet and still, you can faintly hear it pleading for its next meal.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.eme.name: Emerald Talons
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.eme.description: Not all craftsmen work the loom or potter’s wheel. The Balak Taw know - violence too is an art.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.gos.name: Gossamer Gauntlets
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.gos.description: With steel spun fine as a spider’s thread, these blades rip wounds as gaping as a bear's bite.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.gut.name: Gutterpig
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.gut.description: The Boarskin deliberately leave their blades uncleaned. Infection leads to rot, and rot leads to victory .

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.iro.name: Ironstud Interrogators
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.iro.description: The Knights of Tanth popularized this design for both open combat and backroom “questioning”. Answers tend to dislodge as fast as teeth.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.nit.name: Nith Grovebinders
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.nit.description: Wood rots, cloth frays, stone crumbles, but fury smolders eternal.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.rei.name: Reibach's Claws
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.rei.description: It cuts as clean as a surgeon’s scalpel, only its patients rarely recover.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.she.name: Shellguard Gauntlets
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.she.description: One step above tying rocks to your fists - these gloves are meant to pulp and pulverize. Grace is for dancers.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.sun.name: Sun's Scorn
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.sun.description: Some say the sun is fueled by fire. Others insist it’s rage.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.swa.name: Swamp Nail
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.swa.description: War is messy. Why shouldn’t one’s injuries be the same?

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.the.name: The Dawn Never Comes
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.the.description: Cerim texts contain no reference to a life after the Pestilence is gone.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.wov.name: Woven Wraps
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.gauntlets.wov.description: Simple cloth wraps for those who trust that their fists are plenty hard enough.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.ban.name: Bandit's Cleaver
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.ban.description: A heavy iron axe carried often by bandits, and a testament to the fact that not all threats are hollow.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.boa.name: Boarskin Reaper
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.boa.description: There is no piece of nature's bounty and grace that the Boarskin can't defile.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.bro.name: Broken Fang
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.bro.description: A shattered axe, having long since left pieces of itself buried in skulls and rib cages, but still deadly.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.cer.name: Cerim's Skyrend
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.cer.description: Those who can no longer hear the Sayer over the howl of their own madness should be pitied. Pitied and feared.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.gil.name: Gilded Twibill
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.gil.description: "Paint your axe gold, so that your enemies may mistake the shine in their skull for heaven." - old proverb

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.har.name: Harvester's Dread
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.har.description: Before being twisted into Harvesters, many woodsmen would set camp for their families near the forest. Hence the oldest blood on their axes.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.hur.name: Huro's Great Axe
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.hur.description: In the legend of Huro, he used his axe to fell an entire forest, as well as the minor god he angered in doing so.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.mid.name: Midnight Shredder
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.mid.description: Not all great axes are graceless, brutal weapons. But this one is.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.sho.name: Short Bardiche
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.sho.description: It's considered a sign of respect from the Riders of Langold if they face you with the longer of twin axe faces.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.spa.name: Spalled Axe
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greataxes.spa.description: The Dasha people of Marin eschew weapons, but their sturdy axes don't care how they're put to use.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.br.name: Brutish Cudgel
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.br.description: It's an ongoing debate as to whether giants ever roamed the land. Clubs such as these keep the question open.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.ev.name: Evening Star
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.ev.description: No dawn follows the blow of an Evening Star.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.fe.name: Fetid Club
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatclubs.fe.description: As one counts the years ringed on a tree trunk, one can count the lives smeared on this massive staff.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Bud of the Everlasting Tree
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: A strange growth cut from a holy tree - it continues to grow with each swing, as if fed by blood.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Cinder & Stone
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: Studded with small, strange faces, it's said to be the burial tool for a long lost hill tribe.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Festering Cleft
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: A sickly stone affixed to a shaft. Perhaps it will shatter tomorrow. Perhaps never.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Pound of Cadavers
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: The blood, bones, and flesh of fallen warriors woven into a grotesque amalgamation.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Spliced Hammer
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: Originally designed for shattering unruly stones, it seems to take greater pleasure doing the same to skulls.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Tooth of the Ancient One
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: The tooth of an unknown monstrosity. With any luck, its owner is no longer searching for it.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..name: Weeping Earth
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greathammers..description: A tree trunk forms a crude but effective mallet, used by those Risen raiders weighty enough to lift it.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.b.name: Blister
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.b.description: It's said that if a shard of this jagged sword chips off, it will grow in its victim's body, turning their blood to iron.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.c.name: Claymore
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.c.description: A remnant of simpler times, when one knight faced another in an open field.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.c.name: Corpse Smeared Blade
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.c.description: Previously wielded by a plagued monstrosity, no amount of scrubbing seems able to remove the stench.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.name: Falstead's Fury
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.description: This towering blade seems heavy with memory - battles won and lost and never fought.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.name: Festering Earth
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.description: A long buried blade, chewed away by the elements, dragged out of its grave for one final campaign.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.name: Freiheit
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.f.description: A weapon made famous from its use by freedom fighters during the Monksbane Wars.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.g.name: Gnarled Saw
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.g.description: If its first swing doesn't sever a limb, a few back and forth motions will do the trick.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.i.name: Icebreaker
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.i.description: Used in winter to shear off great blocks of ice, it finds other uses year round.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.m.name: Mayhem
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.m.description: The brutal, massive blade of an executioner who has lost their purpose but not their calling.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.name: Shattered Sun
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.description: A design that saw great popularity in Phalen until its designer was caught in bed with the King's nephew.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.name: Sieger
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.description: Stamped with the seal of the great smith Tomlin the Third, its blade will cut a falling feather in two.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.name: Summer's Sting
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.greatswords.s.description: The knights of Elgarth test their blade's edge by counting the stalks of wheat they can fell in a single swing.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.bole.name: Bolein Polearm
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.bole.description: Few sights are more intimidating than a sea of Bolein knights, each hoisting their phoenix beak aloft.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.rega.name: Regal Cleft
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.rega.description: It's tradition for an apprenticing mainland knight to choose the stone to serve as his halberd's counterweight.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.serr.name: Serrated Cutter
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.halberds.serr.description: A grisly polearm carried often by Havenport guards - Governor Grafston's idea of "justice with teeth."

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.hopeS.name: Hope Shorn
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.hopeS.description: The scythe of The Reapers - a sadistic death cult - this unholy weapon whispers a dark thirst.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.scyth.name: Scythe of Wretches
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.scyth.description: Before the pestilence rotted their minds and limbs, the Nith used such scythes to harvest swampgrass roots.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.soulT.name: Soul Thresher
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.scythes.soulT.description: "Easy to separate a head from a neck, far harder to separate a soul from a body." - Thorn executioner axiom

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.careta.name: Caretaker's Ruined Staff
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.careta.description: A Dasha Caretaker's staff, only grown putrid and diseased. Lulling voices can almost be heard wafting from it.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.cursed.name: Cursed Crone
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.cursed.description: Some say witches still lurk in Sacra's dark corners, crafting tools out of wood, mold, and unlucky creatures.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.driedH.name: Dried Hive
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.driedH.description: A dried out hive of spores, tainting the air with each swing, fungi happy to take root inside a foe's lungs.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.endles.name: Endless Winter
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.endles.description: The cold shatters all things – the spirits of men and their bones as well.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.fallin.name: Falling Sky
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.fallin.description: A stave made from a ring of rock that tumbled down from the heavens, its curve strangely perfect.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.falseT.name: False Truth
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.falseT.description: A staff for those who feed on deception, who mimic their meals rather than confront them.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.gnarle.name: Gnarled Staff
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.gnarle.description: The pitiful husk of a tree, once burned by lightning; now it harbors the power to burn grown men to ash.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.pinwhe.name: Pinwheel Staff
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.pinwhe.description: A staff made from a wagon wheel and a fetid urn. There are no limits to man's ingenuity.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.sinner.name: Sinner's Crown
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.sinner.description: For some, atonement is eternal. Shackles cast off, cell opened, but punishment carried with them always.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.spheri.name: Spherin
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.spheri.description: The long-dead guardians of the Frozen Peaks carried these staffs - like all of winter held in a clenched fist.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.stagOf.name: Stag of Embers
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.staves.stagOf.description: A smoldering effigy of occult origins. Whomever holds it speaks for all the forests felled and silenced.

items.gear.weapons.2Handed.unarmed.unarm.name: Unarmed
items.gear.weapons.2Handed.unarmed.unarm.description: You were born with two fists - might as well put them to use.

items.gems.amethysts.chippedAmethyst.description: Can be used to infuse <color=#F2E6BD>weapons</color> and <color=#F2E6BD>armor</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.name: Adept Alchemy Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft potions and elixirs</color>.
Allows the creation of more advanced concoctions than the Apprentice Alchemy Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.name: Apprentice Alchemy Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft potions and elixirs</color>.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.name: Grandmaster Alchemy Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.alchemyT.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft potions and elixirs</color>.
Enables the brewing of rare and complex recipes beyond the Adept Alchemy Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.c.name: Crude Anvil
items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.c.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft weapons and armor</color>.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.f.name: Forged Anvil
items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.f.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft weapons and armor</color>.
Allows the forging of more advanced gear than the Crude Anvil.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.r.name: Runed Anvil
items.houseItems.craftingTables.anvils.r.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft weapons and armor</color>.
Enables the creation of high-quality arms and armor beyond the Forged Anvil.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.name: Ember Firepit
items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>cook meals and stay warm</color>.
Capable of preparing hearty and refined meals beyond the Hearth Firepit.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.name: Hearth Firepit
items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>cook meals and stay warm</color>.
Allows preparation of more advanced dishes than the Simple Firepit.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.name: Simple Firepit
items.houseItems.craftingTables.firepits.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>cook meals and stay warm</color>.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.name: Adept Scribe Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>research new items</color>.
Allows research into more advanced designs than the Novice Scribe Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.name: Archivist Scribe Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>research new items</color>.
Unlocks complex and refined schematics beyond the Adept Scribe Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.name: Novice Scribe Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.scribeTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>research new items</color>.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.name: Apprentice Sewing Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft cloth and leather armor</color>.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.name: Master Sewing Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft cloth and leather armor</color>.
Enables the tailoring of superior outfits beyond the Spinner’s Sewing Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.name: Spinner’s Sewing Table
items.houseItems.craftingTables.sewingTa.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>craft cloth and leather armor</color>.
Allows crafting of more advanced garments than the Apprentice Sewing Table.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.stoves.c.name: Chef’s Stove
items.houseItems.craftingTables.stoves.c.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>cook more advanced meals</color>.
Enables cooking of complex recipes beyond the Cook’s Stove.

Must be placed inside a <color=#F2E6BD>house</color>.

items.houseItems.craftingTables.stoves.c.name: Cook’s Stove
items.houseItems.craftingTables.stoves.c.description:
Used to <color=#F2E6BD>cook more advanced meals</color>.
Allows preparation of finer dishes than the Hearth Stove.

items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.sewerKey.name: Disgusting Key
items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.sewerKey.description: Unlocks a door somewhere in the Black Trench.

items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.sewerLeverHa.name: Sewer Lever Handle
items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.sewerLeverHa.description: A handle which can be used to activate <color=lightblue>multiple levers</color> throughout the Black Trench.

items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.waterChannel.name: Water Channel Key
items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.waterChannel.description: Grants access to the <color=lightblue>central drainage area</color> of Sacrament's sewers.

items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.wetCorpseKey.name: Wet Corpse Key
items.keyItems.sewerDungeon.wetCorpseKey.description: Unlocks a door somewhere in the Black Trench.

items.keyItems.shallows.rustedBarnacleKe.name: Rusted Barnacle Key
items.keyItems.shallows.rustedBarnacleKe.description: An old key, crusted with salt and sea spray. Exchanged hands with many smugglers over the decades.

items.keyItems.shipGraveyard.oldShipCabi.name: Captain's Quarters Key
items.keyItems.shipGraveyard.oldShipCabi.description: Grants access to the private quarters in the stern of the ship.

items.keyItems.shipPrologue.shipPrologue.name: Captain's Chamber Key
items.keyItems.shipPrologue.shipPrologue.description: Grants access to the private quarters in the stern of the ship.

items.projectiles.bombs.bloodGrenade.name: Blood Bomb
items.projectiles.bombs.bloodGrenade.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.bombs.concussiveGrenad.name: Concussive Bomb
items.projectiles.bombs.concussiveGrenad.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.bombs.corrosiveGrenade.name: Corrosive Bomb
items.projectiles.bombs.corrosiveGrenade.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.bombs.direNettleSpores.name: Dire Nettle Spores
items.projectiles.bombs.direNettleSpores.description: If there's a creature, insect, or plant that can feed upon this humble fungus and live, it has yet to be found. Unless your motives are dark, grant it a wide berth.

items.projectiles.bombs.poisonGrenade.name: Poison Bomb
items.projectiles.bombs.poisonGrenade.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Plague Damge</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.bombs.scrapBomb.name: Scrap Bomb
items.projectiles.bombs.scrapBomb.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.flasks.flameflask.name: Flameflask
items.projectiles.flasks.flameflask.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Heat Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.flasks.frostflask.name: Frostflask
items.projectiles.flasks.frostflask.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Cold Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.flasks.plagueflask.name: Plagueflask
items.projectiles.flasks.plagueflask.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Plague Damage</color> at a distance.

items.projectiles.flasks.stormflask.name: Stormflask
items.projectiles.flasks.stormflask.description: Can be hurled to deal <color=#5B9968>{0:0}</color> <color=#F2E6BD>Electric Damage</color> at a distance.

items.questItems.brokenBonds.loveLetter.name: Love Letter (OBSOLETE)
items.questItems.brokenBonds.loveLetter.description: A love letter inside an opened enveloppe.

items.questItems.brokenBonds.loverRemain.name: Lover's Remains (Skull)  (OBSOLETE)
items.questItems.brokenBonds.loverRemain.description: Remains of someone dearly attached to their spouse.

items.questItems.championsHelm.champions.name: The Champion's Crest
items.questItems.championsHelm.champions.description: The prized crest of Sacrament's arena champion.

items.questItems.faithAndFlame.boleinKni.name: Bolein Knight Insignia
items.questItems.faithAndFlame.boleinKni.description: An emblem worn amongst the Bolein Knight ranks.

items.questItems.faithAndFlame.letterFro.name: Message from the Rookery
items.questItems.faithAndFlame.letterFro.description: An urgent message received from the rookery.

items.questItems.penelopeAxe.blueScarf.name: Blue Scarf (OBSOLETE)
items.questItems.penelopeAxe.blueScarf.description: Penelope's favorite blue scarf, found near a mutilated corpse.

items.questItems.penelopeAxe.portrait.name: Penelope's Portrait (OBSOLETE)
items.questItems.penelopeAxe.portrait.description: Elegant portrait of a beautiful woman.

items.questItems.questItem.DeadtideDocks.name: Deadtide Docks Key
items.questItems.questItem.DeadtideDocks.description: An old key that unlocks the gate leading to the deadtide docks.

items.questItems.questItem.letterForElls.name: Letter for Ellsworth
items.questItems.questItem.letterForElls.description: A letter for Ellsworth from the mainland. Stamped with the royal seal.

items.questItems.questItem.lostPendant.name: Lost Pendant (OBSOLETE)
items.questItems.questItem.lostPendant.description: Jack has asked you to retrieve this pendant from the fortress.

items.questItems.questItem.plagueIchor.name: Plague Ichor
items.questItems.questItem.plagueIchor.description: A gruesome, sickly substance. Some believe it can be used by Cerim to <color=#F2E6BD>enhance their abilities</color>.

items.questItems.questItem.refinedIchor.name: Refined Ichor
items.questItems.questItem.refinedIchor.description: Plague ichor that has been refined by the Watcher. When consumed by Cerim it can <color=#F2E6BD>enhance their abilities</color>.

items.questItems.rootsThatBind.kestrelCl.name: Kestrel's Egg
items.questItems.rootsThatBind.kestrelCl.description: Odessa says this egg may open the Winged Door and grant access to the treetops of the Balak Taw.

items.questItems.severedHand.rivenTwinsK.name: Riven Twins Cell Key
items.questItems.severedHand.rivenTwinsK.description: A key to the cell where the Riven Twins were imprisoned, somewhere in Nameless Pass.

items.questItems.severedHand.rivenTwinsM.name: Riven Twins Map
items.questItems.severedHand.rivenTwinsM.description: A map that used to belong to the Riven Twins, found inside their cell.

items.questItems.severedHand.savorStashK.name: Savor Stash Key
items.questItems.severedHand.savorStashK.description: A key to a secret Savor stash in Ship Graveyard.

items.questItems.severedHand.tortureRoom.name: Torture Room Key
items.questItems.severedHand.tortureRoom.description: A key to the torture room inside the Severed Hand's Sanctum.

items.questItems.sparrowHorn.sparrowHorn.name: Sparrow Horn
items.questItems.sparrowHorn.sparrowHorn.description: An ornate but weathered horn found washed up on Sacra's coast.

items.questItems.spokenAndUnspoken.ancie.name: Ancient Stone Tablet
items.questItems.spokenAndUnspoken.ancie.description: An intact slab of stone covered in Cerim inscriptions. An expert historian could translate what's written here.

items.questItems.spokenAndUnspoken.oldLe.name: Old Leather Tome
items.questItems.spokenAndUnspoken.oldLe.description: An ancient book discovered by Roan in the rookery. It contains a completed inscription sought by the historian Elsa.

items.questItems.weepingSisters.sorasLet.name: Sora's Letter
items.questItems.weepingSisters.sorasLet.description: A sealed letter, given by Hunter Sora. To be delivered to Eleanor in Sacrament.

items.readableItems.books.oldTome.name: Chronicle of the High Kings
items.readableItems.books.oldTome.description: A detailed account of the reigns and deeds of the High Kings, richly illustrated, a treasure for any historian.

items.readableItems.letters.oldLetter.name: Sealed Royal Missive
items.readableItems.letters.oldLetter.description: A letter from the royal court, its contents secured by a wax seal, awaiting the eyes of its intended recipient.

items.readableItems.plaques.oldPlaque.name: Tablet of Ancestral Chronicles
items.readableItems.plaques.oldPlaque.description: A weathered stone tablet etched with the dense script of ages past, chronicling the deep lore of an ancient civilization.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollA.name: Arcane Scrolls of Eld
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollA.description: Bound by time and mystic twine, these scrolls contain the lost wisdom of a forgotten age, etched onto weathered parchment.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollB.name: Triad of Wisdom Scrolls
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollB.description: Three venerable scrolls, each a compendium of forgotten knowledge, wrapped in mystery and history.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollC.name: Codex of the Council
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollC.description: A set of scrolls containing the collected decrees and wisdom of the ancient Council, bound in secrecy.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollD.name: Sage's Scroll of Wisdom
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollD.description: A venerable scroll that has traveled through the hands of wise sages, inscribed with timeless wisdom and philosophical musings.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollE.name: Codex of Timeless Truths
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollE.description: A timeless codex, its parchments hold truths that have traversed the span of ages unaltered.

items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollF.name: Cerim's Scroll of Insight
items.readableItems.scrolls.scrollF.description: A venerable scroll bearing Cerim's enigmatic script, said to unlock the path to ancient wisdom and forgotten lore.

items.runes.advancingFlurry.name: Advancing Flurry
items.runes.advancingFlurry.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Advancing Flurry</color> Rune Attack.

Advance while unleashing a rapid flurry of strikes, pushing back enemies with each hit.

items.runes.airDodge.name: Air Dodge
items.runes.airDodge.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Air Dodge</color> Rune Attack.

Execute an aerial roll to evade attacks, then immediately counter with a swift, forward stab.

items.runes.armageddon.name: Armageddon
items.runes.armageddon.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Armageddon</color> Rune Attack.

Call down a devastating inferno in front of you, engulfing the area in a massive explosion of fire.

items.runes.arrowstorm.name: Arrowstorm
items.runes.arrowstorm.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Arrowstorm</color> Rune Attack.

Fire a lone arrow skyward, calling down a punishing rain of arrows that showers the battlefield and overwhelms foes caught beneath it.

items.runes.balanceSmash.name: Balance Smash
items.runes.balanceSmash.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Two-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Balance Smash</color> Rune Attack.

Balance atop your weapon as you roll over it, then seize it firmly to deliver a ground-shattering smash.

items.runes.bareKnuckle.name: Bare Knuckle
items.runes.bareKnuckle.description:
Slot this Rune into <color=#F2E6BD>Gauntlets</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Bare Knuckle</color> Rune Attack.

Wind up and lunge forward with explosive force, delivering a powerful punch that knocks enemies clean off their feet.

items.runes.berserkFlurry.name: Berserk Flurry
items.runes.berserkFlurry.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Two-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Berserk Flurry</color> Rune Attack.

Channel the fury of a berserker and surge forward, unleashing four rapid, powerful swings to overwhelm your foes.

items.runes.berserkStrike.name: Berserk Strike
items.runes.berserkStrike.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Two-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Berserk Strike</color> Rune Attack.

Thump your chest to fuel your rage, then deliver a devastating strike that crushes the enemy with brutal force.

items.runes.blazingRupture.name: Blazing Rupture
items.runes.blazingRupture.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Blazing Rupture</color> Rune Attack.

Smash your weapon into the ground to create a fiery explosion, then spin in a searing arc to strike nearby enemies with burning force.

items.runes.blink.name: Blink
items.runes.blink.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Utility Slot</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Blink</color> Spell.

Harness mystical energy to teleport forward a short distance, even passing through enemies to evade or position strategically.

items.runes.bolt.name: Bolt
items.runes.bolt.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Bolt</color> Rune Attack.

Cast a crackling lightning bolt that electrifies enemies on impact. Charge it to increase its shocking power and deal more damage.

items.runes.breakerThrust.name: Breaker Thrust
items.runes.breakerThrust.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Two-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Breaker Thrust</color> Rune Attack.

Lunge forward with overwhelming force, thrusting your weapon into enemies to knock them off their feet.

items.runes.breakrush.name: Breakrush
items.runes.breakrush.description:
Slot this Rune into <color=#F2E6BD>Gauntlets</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Breakrush</color> Rune Attack.

Unleash a barrage of quick strikes in rapid succession, pummeling your opponent with relentless blows.

items.runes.breakstep.name: Breakstep
items.runes.breakstep.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Breakstep</color> Rune Attack.

Drive a sharp kick into your foe, then follow through with three rapid arrows before they can recover.

items.runes.brutalReprise.name: Brutal Reprise
items.runes.brutalReprise.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Brutal Reprise</color> Rune Attack.

Swing your weapon in a brutal flourish, then unleash three heavy strikes in rapid succession to overpower your enemy.

items.runes.busterRift.name: Buster Rift
items.runes.busterRift.description:
Slot this Rune into <color=#F2E6BD>Gauntlets</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Buster Rift</color> Technique.

Deliver a ground-tearing punch that launches a tremor wave forward, then slide back and fire a second explosive strike.

items.runes.chainLightning.name: Chain Lightning
items.runes.chainLightning.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Chain Lightning</color> Rune Attack.

Unleash a lightning bolt that strikes your target and, when charged, arcs to hit additional nearby enemies, electrifying the battlefield.

items.runes.channel.name: Channel
items.runes.channel.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Utility Slot</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Channel</color> Spell.

Charge this spell to draw in sacred energy, sacrificing health to gain focus and amplify your mystical power.

items.runes.chargeStrike.name: Charge Strike
items.runes.chargeStrike.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Charge Strike</color> Rune Attack.

Charge forward with lethal momentum, culminating in a brutal strike that devastates any foe in your path.

items.runes.chargedBolt.name: Charged Bolt
items.runes.chargedBolt.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Charged Bolt</color> Rune Attack.

Release bolts of lightning in all directions, shocking nearby enemies with surging energy.

items.runes.chargedShot.name: Arrow
items.runes.chargedShot.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Arrow</color> Rune Attack.

A fundamental archer’s skill, release a swift and precise arrow aimed straight at the heart of your adversary.

items.runes.circular.name: Circular
items.runes.circular.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>One-Handed Weapon</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Circular</color> Rune Attack.

Execute a swift spin, striking enemies twice with a powerful circular attack that hits all around you.

items.runes.coldAffliction.name: Cold Affliction
items.runes.coldAffliction.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Utility Slot</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Cold Affliction</color> Spell.

Envelop enemies in biting frost, increasing the ice damage and freeze buildup they receive for a short duration.

items.runes.coldEnchantment.name: Cold Enchantment
items.runes.coldEnchantment.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Utility Slot</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Cold Enchantment</color> Spell.

Infuse your weapon with the essence of cold, chilling foes with frosty strikes that slow their advance.

items.runes.coldResistance.name: Cold Resistance
items.runes.coldResistance.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Utility Slot</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Cold Resistance</color> Spell.

Fortify yourself against cold-based attacks, reducing ice damage and increasing your resilience to freezing effects.

items.runes.coldSling.name: Cold Sling
items.runes.coldSling.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Cold Sling</color> Rune Attack.

Leap into the air and hurl three icy projectiles in rapid succession toward your target.

items.runes.coneShot.name: Cone Shot
items.runes.coneShot.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Bow</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Cone Shot</color> Rune Attack.

Unleash a concentrated burst of arrows in a narrow cone, overwhelming a single target or any in close proximity with a powerful volley.

items.runes.convergingFlame.name: Converging Flame
items.runes.convergingFlame.description:
Slot this Rune into a <color=#F2E6BD>Wand</color> or a <color=#F2E6BD>Staff</color> to gain the <color=#F2E6BD>Converging Flame</color> Rune Attack.
